fields.meta_keywords: Cerner Ltd, EPIC, McKesson, software, EMR, EPR, patient, clinic, clinical
fields.meta_description: The DXC UltraGenda solution suite is a healthcare-specific enterprise scheduling and resource management system.
fields.page_body: DXC UltraGenda provides appointment booking, resource scheduling, online referrals and bookings, followup of planned appointments, and management reporting tools for hospitals, primary and community healthcare organizations. It helps healthcare organizations improve efficiency, enhances the quality of patient experience, and increases staff productivity and accountability. Hospitals and primary and community healthcare delivery organizations are under increased pressure to achieve efficiencies and quality of service. This makes cooperation across departments essential for the efficient delivery of healthcare services. DXC UltraGenda Enterprise Scheduling solution offers a robust, generic software product to better manage the scheduling processes, reducing inefficiency and improving service levels. DXC UltraGenda provides not only high quality packaged software, but a complete approach to take healthcare scheduling to the next level. Leading the way with digital health platforms — DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Comprehensive solution that is deployed alongside different EMR/EPRs — DXC UltraGenda provides a best of breed solution for all healthcare resourcing needs that can be deployed alongside one or more EMR or EPR systems. Quick to deploy for small scale services — For an Enterprise scheduling system DXC UltraGenda can be quick to deploy for a pilot or single department or small organization use. DXC UltraGenda already has a deploy base across a large number of customer across Europe and ANZ. DXC UltraGenda has been deployed against a large number of different EMR and EPR systems.. Manage Resources Efficiently for Direct Cost Savings Client Challenges: Need to reduce the time to book appointments by eliminating paperwork and optimizing the workflow. Move the booking process to the source of the request: department, nurse, departmental secretary. Allow secretaries to change departments without complications. Create a floating secretarial staff. Current State: Internal appointments are ordered via paper documents. Booking complex and grouped appointments - even spread over distinct departments and sites - is a very challenging exercise. Booking rules, doctors' preferences and specific exceptions are known only by dedicated secretaries. Desired Future State: Paperless; Bookings at source; Agile, lean staffing across departments. DXC Answer: UltraGenda Pro (UltraGenda's core solution) allows appointment booking at the source: the physician, a departmental nurse or secretaries in other departments. Several appointments can be booked at once, across departments and distinct sites. The simple user interface is intuitive, and training takes only a few hours, which allows switching secretaries between departments, setting up a floating staff and using interim workers. UG Broka (the internet branch of UltraGenda) enforces this booking at the source by allowing external referrers and patients to book appointments. Empower Patients Client Challenges: Healthcare providers are involved in every patient interaction. This is very time-consuming and often does not add value. Administrative tasks can be done without staff interference. From a patient perspective, every interaction is dependent on the availability of the care provider and their staff. This does often not match with their personal agenda. Current State: Hospitals are unable to allow patients to manage their own appointments, due to current booking systems lacking intelligent, configurable business rules to support this process. As a result, hospitals are required to employ large numbers of staff to fulfill patients' scheduling needs and to communicate patients' requirements. Desired Future State: Empowered patients, who are able to do more by themselves when and where they wish. This requires a solution that supports the business requirements, without a degradation in service or outcome. The right patient is seen at the right time in the right department for the right activity, thanks to intelligent rules. DXC Answer: DXC UltraGenda Broka (UltraGenda's web portal solution) empowers patients in the appointment booking process. Patients can book, cancel, and reschedule appointments, all without interference from healthcare provider staff, but in line with the demands and requirements of the healthcare provider. Reduce No-shows Client Challenges: Patients are very busy with their own activities and often forget their medical appointments. Current State: Healthcare providers are often faced with no-shows for appointments, resulting in the waste of expensive resources.. Desired Future State: Increased attendance rate at appointments, due to improved Healthcare Provider-Patient communication and involvement DXC Answer: DXC UltraGenda Pro provides patients with a convenient appointment reminder service. Reminders can be attached to both single and multiple appointments, so that patients receive advanced warning of upcoming appointments, enabling them to confirm, reschedule or cancel them. Availability: Global Pricing/Licensing model: Licenses are priced based on the size of an organization. This size is based on the number of Full Time Equivalents (FTEs) in the hospital (i.e., all staff, from housekeeping to physicians and professors). For very small institutions that do not require complex booking (e.g., booking a room, booking a physician), a renting model may be considered based on the number of schedules. Implementation: Depending on the size of the organization, a typical implementation starts from 25 days of technical and functional services, but this can easily exceed hundreds or even thousands of days for very large implementations. Please contact the Offering Manager listed in the contacts section for latest information on client wins. Competition Competition tends to come from comprehensive Electronic Patient Record (EPR) systems such as those provided by Cerner, EPIC and McKesson and dedicated scheduling systems Schedule an introduction to DXC UltraGenda via a demonstration.

fields.meta_keywords: healthcare, medicaid, processor, automation, claim, claims, case management
fields.meta_description: The DXC Payer Portfolio (DPP) leverages DXC's vast experience and innovation expertise to provide the modularity and technology that US state governments need to deliver high-quality and timely Medicaid services, using a cloud-based platform and a software-as-a-service (SaaS) approach.
fields.page_body: DXC offers a breadth of healthcare-related offerings that meet all the needs for managing a complex Medicaid program. The DXC Payer Portfolio offers an important alternative to current systems and methods states use to manage Medicaid services. The offering provides the modularity required by federal Medicaid mandates — it unites automation, standardization and process maturity into easy-to-use modules that are always available and always current. The DXC Payer Portfolio is a unique, discrete suite of payment solutions that can be acquired individually or as part of a complete modular payer solution to process and adjudicate claims, assess eligibility, manage memberships, coordinate care of Medicaid populations, manage healthcare costs, support coordinated case management, and prevent fraud and abuse of Medicaid services. The DXC Payer Portfolio modules are designed to reduce costs through automation and improved efficiency, enabling better outcomes using fewer resources. In addition the offering provides an increase in ease of use and data accuracy while improving modularity and interoperability. In order to meet federal guidelines and support tighter controls the DXC Payer Portfolio is designed to offer greater investigative capabilities and meet federal CMS requirements. DXC is the largest Medicaid processor in the United States, providing business processing, IT development and administrative services for Medicaid programs across the country. We have long been a leader in providing states and their Medicaid beneficiaries with advanced technology that facilitates cost savings while delivering performance efficiencies and improved outcomes in care. Our proven software and SaaS architecture offer clients interoperable, collaborative and standardized systems that deliver high-quality care to millions of Medicaid beneficiaries nationwide. 971 Million claims processed 117 Billion claim dollars paid. 2.1 Million healthcare providers served 5.1 Million customer service calls answered 32 State government contracts Massive changes are underway in how Medicaid programs finance care, manage operations and procure crucial products and services — all while sharing and collaborating with other government entities. Responding to these changes requires fundamental shifts in the Medicaid operating model and in the technologies to improve care outcomes, facilitate cost savings and achieve performance efficiencies Regional Availability—America only TCV—$50-500m Contract Length—5-10 years; typically structured as a 3-5 year base + 1-year options Implementation (DDI, TMO)—24-48 months (28-36 months is typical) Deal structure—Typically, a business process services deal supported with DXC technology products Pricing Model Fixed price DDI: deliverables based or time-based ($X per month) Operations: per claim, per beneficiary, per call (for call center), or fixed  CLIENT REGION INDUSTRY CLOSED/WON  Wisconsin Department of Health Services Americas Healthcare Q2 FY2019 CalWIN Americas Healthcare Q2 FY2020 Tenncare Americas Healthcare Q2 FY2020 Competition Conduent: Conduent has an in-depth knowledge of MMIS and claims processing systems as well as an understanding in payment methods such as DRG, RBRVS, APC, RUG and fee schedules. CNSI: Expertise in developing, implementing & operating cutting edge technological solutions that modernize state MMIS. WIPRO: 25+ years of experience in providing Medicaid fiscal agent services. Delivers services through a cloud-based HIPAA compliant data centre. Share the module offering overviews for the areas of service the client is interested in. Engage an Industry consultant to understand client requirements

fields.meta_keywords: hospitals, labs, lab, laboratories, clinic, medical, preventive, nurse, nursing, nurses, pathology
fields.meta_description: DXC x-HIS and eSIAP is an Electronic Patient Record (EPR) designed for emerging markets. Our combined offering supports a coordinated and holistic healthcare delivery along with improving clinical quality and professional collaboration.
fields.page_body: DXC x-HIS allows hospitals to replace paper documents with an electronic file system that collects all the patient medical and administrative information automatically from multiple information sources. The patient's medical history is drawn from medical and administrative information for a hospital or group of hospitals combined with data from referral hospitals, speciality centres, laboratories, RIS and PAC systems, accounting systems, and other information sources. Furthermore, users are able to navigate through all of a patient's medical records without any need to exit and enter the system. x-HIS presents the records in a highly intuitive interface which speeds up information identification and reduces training time and costs. Key FunctionsFor the administrative management of centres and hospital resources: Invoicing Pharmacy Logistics Human resources Coding Conventions Schedule managements Patient Administration (PAS): Admission Accident and Emergency Outpatients Surgical Team Medical history files Orientated towards management: Integrated control panel Business Intelligence Solutions Clinics: Nursing station Medical station Management of clinical requests and results Electronic medical history Prescription record forms Capture and Management of clinical images Nursing care plans Departments: Intensive care unit Clinical laboratories Pathology Radiology Blood products Nutrition and dietetics Physiotherapy Systems: General maintenance System administration By combining two market-leading offerings with a single database, DXC has created a comprehensive solution for integrated patient management across primary care facilities and hospitals. Together, x-HIS (for acute care) and eSIAP (for primary and preventive care) create an optimal electronic patient information system, with clinical and administrative information. DXC x-HIS is for medium to large acute hospitals looking to implement and benefit from a full electronic patient record, treatment pathway planning, and full supporting modules. This integrated solution helps health providers cut the cost of managing multiple systems and reduces the time spent locating and accessing information, giving users enhanced ability to analyze patient data for more effective clinical decision making. Leading the way with digital health platforms — DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Proven product for market — Product is proven and referenceable within the market Product is deployed and live at a number of healthcare organizations across Southern Europe and Latin America. Based on open, standards-based design, the solution can and has been implemented across a network of healthcare delivery settings and can be deployed to healthcare enterprises of any size. To secure better clinical outcomes Client Challenges: Success for hospital providers is defined by achieving the best possible clinical outcome for each patient. Currently, this is a challenge as full information about a patient's treatment and their care pathway may not be available to all treating clinicians, leading to poor decisions and deviations from best practice. There is also a need to comply with an ever-increasing range of targets and quality measures. Current State: Healthcare records are still largely paper-based, which constrains where and when healthcare can be delivered. Desired Future State: Information about a patient's treatment and care pathway available easily so all treating clinicians can understand the case and conform to best practice. DXC Answer: DXC x-HIS replaces paper by collecting information about a patient into a single comprehensive Electronic Patient Record (EPR) which gives everyone involved in the delivery of care to that patient access to all the information they need, regardless of where they are located. x-HIS offers a dynamic, agile assistance and time optimization, releasing admin tasks, promoting the best Care Quality and improving safety processes for the patient. Interoperability Client Challenges: Staffing and skillsets are not available to integrate aging systems. Current State: Customers need to integrate a multitude of third-party departmental solutions in order to present a unified and broad view of a patient. Desired Future State: Disparate systems are integrated and data is available electronically. DXC Answer: x-HIS is an interoperable solution with the ability to integrate a multitude of administrative, clinical, and departmental functions. Reducing costs Client Challenges: Healthcare organizations are under significant budget constraints as the cost of healthcare continues to rise. Current State: Some hospitals are still largely run on paper-based systems. This means that information is captured on paper and then often keyed into a computer system later by administrative staff. This is inefficient in a number of ways: It requires administrative staff to capture information at additional cost Paper is sometimes lost, resulting in some activity not being recorded and, therefore, not billed Information is sometimes transcribed incorrectly, thereby leading to incorrect billing. Desired Future State: Integrated patient record captured at the point of care. DXC Answer: x-HIS can help reduce costs by: Ensuring that all activity is properly recorded; Reducing duplicate data; Reducing processes improving the decision making process; and optimizing existing systems. Target Market: Southern Europe and Latin America Average TCV: $4M Primary Buyer: Combination of C-level Executives CEO and CIO of the health organizations Please contact the Offering Manager listed in the contacts section for latest information on client wins. Competition The broad scope of an EPR system means that competition exists in a number of functional domains, such as PAS, Clinicals and Clinical Documentation systems. Everis/NTT data: Everis is a multinational consulting firm providing business and strategy solutions, application development, maintenance, and outsourcing services for the Healthcare industry. Everis was acquired by the NTT Data Group based in Japan which now allows them to offer a wider range of solutions and services through increased capacity, as well as technological, geographical, and financial resources. Cerner Millenium: Highly mature and clinically rich solution delivered in a number of markets. Mature product with good referenceability and large customer base especially in US. Cerner acquired the Siemens Healthcare IT activities in 2014 (including Soarian). EPIC EpicCare: Highly successful large US EPR provider with a reputation for rich clinical functionality, but also for being expensive. Deals won due to rich functionality, complete clinical content and good referencability. Epic tends to contract only large healthcare organizations. Indra: Indra is the leading consulting and technology multinational in Spain and Latin America. It provides solutions and services for the Transport and Traffic, Energy and Industry, Public Administration and Healthcare, Financial Services, Security and Defense and Telecom and Media sectors. Within healthcare, it typically provides bespoke solutions for customers. Schedule an introduction to DXC x-HISe with the DXC team.

fields.meta_keywords: aged care, hospitals, risk, medication, errors, clinic, clinical, nurses, doctors, pharmacists
fields.meta_description: DXC MedChart is an electronic medication management system, targeted to government health departments, public and private acute care hospitals, and aged care facilities in Australia, New Zealand, and the UK.
fields.page_body: DXC's MedChart provides hospitals, clinics and aged care facilities with an end-to-end electronic medication management (eMM) solution, helping healthcare organizations reduce clinical risk and improve medication safety. MedChart eliminates complex, time-consuming manual and paper-driven medication management processes, reducing errors, improving efficiency and enabling greater coordination between clinical teams for better patient care. MedChart Features Electronic Medication Chart Electronic Prescribing Pharmacy Review Decision Support Ward Overview Medication Administration Reference Viewer Outpatients Forms Writer Benefits Accurate, efficient and timely medications administration A clear picture of each patient's medication record, accessible at any time Reduction in manual, paper chart-based inaccuracies and medication errors Decision support configurable to support the various needs of the care team - promoting best practices while preserving clinical freedom Greater pharmacist/pharmacy involvement in clinical care Ability for nurses to coordinate care and share responsibilities Improved communication between nursing, medical, and pharmacy staff Configurable protocols to support quality-based complex prescribing Delivery of security and traceability throughout the medication process Healthcare organizations are under pressure to reduce adverse drug events causing harm to patients, reduce spending on medications and improve efficiency. Implementing an electronic medication management system is well documented to immediately improve medication prescribing and administration practices, reduce incidence of medication error and improve collaboration among the doctors, nurses and pharmacists to deliver faster and better care. Leading the way with digital health platforms — DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Usability — MedChart is widely considered by clinicians as the most user-friendly system currently available in the market. Proven product — MedChart is tried, tested and proven, used by leading hospitals in Australia, New Zealand and the UK, and includes a range of separate workflows for optimum medication management. Electronic medication management (eMM) systems have been shown to reduce the rate of potential adverse drug events (ADE) by 71% leading to estimated savings of A$63-66 per admission (MedChart) (Westbrook, 2012). Use of MedChart has seen annual savings of $100k per 30-bed ward (Westbrook, 2015) “Waitemata DHB has MedChart deployed across approximately 970 beds on three campuses with the remaining 130 adult beds scheduled to be deployed by the end of 2017. Over 1000 active prescribers can access MedChart from any device that has access to the DHB’s network, and 2,500 nurses use iPad mini devices to administer more than 300,000 doses of medication per month. Feedback has been that MedChart reduces administration errors, and reduces the time spent trying to locate paper medication records. MedChart has certainly had a positive impact on medication management at Waitemata DHB.” - David Ryan, Project Manager, Waitemata DHB Build and maintain a reputation for delivering excellent healthcare (patient safety) Client Challenges: Clinical negligence cases continue to rise due to avoidable mistakes in hospitals. In a market that is increasingly seeing hospitals competing with each other for patients, it is important that the service is seen to be good for both referring GPs and patients. Current State: Mistakes happen in hospitals, often due to poor information availability which prompts contra-indicated prescribing and treatment. Poor communication with related health professionals regarding the patient care pathway/treatment discourages referrals. Desired Future State: A clear record of all treatment for clinicians and automatic alerts for repeat or contra-indicated medication prescribing and administration reduces mistakes. Instant production of treatment records for related health professionals ensures good communications and encourages repeat referrals. DXC Answer: Many of the problems with mistakes in hospitals stem from the use of handwritten, paper-based systems. The replacement of handwritten notes and prescribing forms with a legible, secure electronic record will reduce simple errors. Medchart does this. With patient information in electronic form clinicians can be supported with decision support systems to ensure that simple errors such as dose miscalculation, drug-to-drug reactions and allergies can be flagged by the system. Enhance operational efficiency / increase resource utilization Client Challenges: Current paper-based medicine management processes struggle to meet the demands of a modern healthcare service, are often not efficient and are prone to errors and duplication. In addition, poor medicines management can lead to pressure on drug expenditure. Current State: Healthcare records are still largely paper-based, which constrains delivery and safety of healthcare and increases costs. Desired Future State: Information about a patient's treatment and care pathway available easily so all treating clinicians can understand the case and conform to best practice. DXC Answer: MedChart eliminates paper by providing a real-time, comprehensive electronic patient medication record; the medication record gives authorized healthcare practitioners involved in the patients' care access to all the information they need, regardless of where they are located. MedChart improves the quality of information captured by enabling information to be captured at the point of care delivery. It supports local formulary management at the point of prescribing, such as prescribing protocols and preferred treatment regimes. It gives administrators and clinicians the tools to record patient information in real-time. Reducing costs Client Challenges: Healthcare organizations are under significant budget constraints as the cost of healthcare continues to rise. Current State: Some hospitals are still largely run on paper-based systems, expenditure on drugs is rising and inability to manage high-cost treatments to specific groups of prescribers. Desired Future State: Integrated patient record captured along with prescribing guidance at a point of care to the most cost-effective and proven treatment regimes coupled with the ability to restrict high-cost treatments to specific groups of prescribers. DXC Answer: DXC Medchart provides a single integrated information source that enables hospitals to change their business process to ensure that information is being captured electronically and prescribing managed in real-time. Availability: Australia, New Zealand, UK and Ireland Typical Initial Conract length: 5-7 years Average TCV: $3M  CLIENT REGION INDUSTRY CLOSED/WON  The Mid Yorkshire Hospitals NHS Trust UK Healthcare Q4 2018 HealthScope Limited Australia Healthcare Q4 2019 Competition Competition tends to come from comprehensive Electronic Patient Record (EPR) systems and dedicated clinical systems. AllScripts Sunrise Acute Care: Clinicals focused product. Prescribing largely based on US model. Ascribe: Strong market share with a very capable product. Cerner Millenium: Highly mature and clinically rich solution delivered in a number of markets including the UK as part of the NPfIT programme. Mature product with good referenceability and large customer base especially in the US. Requires a full system to get eMM functionality. EPIC EpicCare: Highly successful large US EPR provider with a reputation for rich clinical functionality, but also for being expensive. Deals won due to rich functionality, complete clinical content and good referencability. Epic tends to contract only large healthcare organizations. Requires full system to get eMM functionality Harris CareFX: Harris-CareFX's patient and clinician portal platform provides integrated clinical record. Schedule an introduction session to DXC MedChart with the DXC team.
fields.title: DXC MedChart
fields.full_body: aged care, hospitals, risk, medication, errors, clinic, clinical, nurses, doctors, pharmacists DXC MedChart is an electronic medication management system, targeted to government health departments, public and private acute care hospitals, and aged care facilities in Australia, New Zealand, and the UK. DXC's MedChart provides hospitals, clinics and aged care facilities with an end-to-end electronic medication management (eMM) solution, helping healthcare organizations reduce clinical risk and improve medication safety. MedChart eliminates complex, time-consuming manual and paper-driven medication management processes, reducing errors, improving efficiency and enabling greater coordination between clinical teams for better patient care. MedChart Features Electronic Medication Chart Electronic Prescribing Pharmacy Review Decision Support Ward Overview Medication Administration Reference Viewer Outpatients Forms Writer Benefits Accurate, efficient and timely medications administration A clear picture of each patient's medication record, accessible at any time Reduction in manual, paper chart-based inaccuracies and medication errors Decision support configurable to support the various needs of the care team - promoting best practices while preserving clinical freedom Greater pharmacist/pharmacy involvement in clinical care Ability for nurses to coordinate care and share responsibilities Improved communication between nursing, medical, and pharmacy staff Configurable protocols to support quality-based complex prescribing Delivery of security and traceability throughout the medication process Healthcare organizations are under pressure to reduce adverse drug events causing harm to patients, reduce spending on medications and improve efficiency. Implementing an electronic medication management system is well documented to immediately improve medication prescribing and administration practices, reduce incidence of medication error and improve collaboration among the doctors, nurses and pharmacists to deliver faster and better care. Leading the way with digital health platforms — DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Usability — MedChart is widely considered by clinicians as the most user-friendly system currently available in the market. Proven product — MedChart is tried, tested and proven, used by leading hospitals in Australia, New Zealand and the UK, and includes a range of separate workflows for optimum medication management. Electronic medication management (eMM) systems have been shown to reduce the rate of potential adverse drug events (ADE) by 71% leading to estimated savings of A$63-66 per admission (MedChart) (Westbrook, 2012). Use of MedChart has seen annual savings of $100k per 30-bed ward (Westbrook, 2015) “Waitemata DHB has MedChart deployed across approximately 970 beds on three campuses with the remaining 130 adult beds scheduled to be deployed by the end of 2017. Over 1000 active prescribers can access MedChart from any device that has access to the DHB’s network, and 2,500 nurses use iPad mini devices to administer more than 300,000 doses of medication per month. Feedback has been that MedChart reduces administration errors, and reduces the time spent trying to locate paper medication records. MedChart has certainly had a positive impact on medication management at Waitemata DHB.” - David Ryan, Project Manager, Waitemata DHB Build and maintain a reputation for delivering excellent healthcare (patient safety) Client Challenges: Clinical negligence cases continue to rise due to avoidable mistakes in hospitals. In a market that is increasingly seeing hospitals competing with each other for patients, it is important that the service is seen to be good for both referring GPs and patients. Current State: Mistakes happen in hospitals, often due to poor information availability which prompts contra-indicated prescribing and treatment. Poor communication with related health professionals regarding the patient care pathway/treatment discourages referrals. Desired Future State: A clear record of all treatment for clinicians and automatic alerts for repeat or contra-indicated medication prescribing and administration reduces mistakes. Instant production of treatment records for related health professionals ensures good communications and encourages repeat referrals. DXC Answer: Many of the problems with mistakes in hospitals stem from the use of handwritten, paper-based systems. The replacement of handwritten notes and prescribing forms with a legible, secure electronic record will reduce simple errors. Medchart does this. With patient information in electronic form clinicians can be supported with decision support systems to ensure that simple errors such as dose miscalculation, drug-to-drug reactions and allergies can be flagged by the system. Enhance operational efficiency / increase resource utilization Client Challenges: Current paper-based medicine management processes struggle to meet the demands of a modern healthcare service, are often not efficient and are prone to errors and duplication. In addition, poor medicines management can lead to pressure on drug expenditure. Current State: Healthcare records are still largely paper-based, which constrains delivery and safety of healthcare and increases costs. Desired Future State: Information about a patient's treatment and care pathway available easily so all treating clinicians can understand the case and conform to best practice. DXC Answer: MedChart eliminates paper by providing a real-time, comprehensive electronic patient medication record; the medication record gives authorized healthcare practitioners involved in the patients' care access to all the information they need, regardless of where they are located. MedChart improves the quality of information captured by enabling information to be captured at the point of care delivery. It supports local formulary management at the point of prescribing, such as prescribing protocols and preferred treatment regimes. It gives administrators and clinicians the tools to record patient information in real-time. Reducing costs Client Challenges: Healthcare organizations are under significant budget constraints as the cost of healthcare continues to rise. Current State: Some hospitals are still largely run on paper-based systems, expenditure on drugs is rising and inability to manage high-cost treatments to specific groups of prescribers. Desired Future State: Integrated patient record captured along with prescribing guidance at a point of care to the most cost-effective and proven treatment regimes coupled with the ability to restrict high-cost treatments to specific groups of prescribers. DXC Answer: DXC Medchart provides a single integrated information source that enables hospitals to change their business process to ensure that information is being captured electronically and prescribing managed in real-time. fields.meta_keywords: security, information governance, compliance, business efficiency, productivity
fields.meta_description: DXC Data Governance enables our clients to improve and streamline information processes to ensure high data quality throughout the data life cycle.
fields.page_body: DXC Data Governance enables our clients to improve and streamline information processes to ensure high data quality throughout the data life cycle. It encompasses people, processes and IT to consistently and properly handle an organization’s data. It also provides data management practices with the foundation, strategy and structure to ensure that data is managed as an asset and transformed into meaningful information. DXC Data Governance improves compliance, business efficiency and productivity, information security, and operational costs. DXC offers flexible delivery options (on-premises, as a service, or hybrid) and commercial models to minimize investment risk. Massive amounts of data mean nothing if clients cannot internalize, visualize and optimize information to make the crucial decisions that will lead to growth and tangible outcomes. The integration of DXC Data Governance with end to end solutions that match key business needs enable DXC Technology clients to achieve measurable business benefits. A packaged goods company achieved cost savings in excess of $10M with a single, consolidated and harmonized spend analysis database that allows the company to leverage opportunities globally and more effectively manage external spend, enabled by master data management (MDM).  DXC implemented MDM for a global energy company to create the single source for well productivity, crucial for guiding investment decisions. A proof of concept (PoC) for 200 wells demonstrated improved insight, quality and cost reduction, and the company then rolled MDM out to 20,000 wells.  For a leading automotive manufacturer, DXC delivered a data governance program for warranty data — structured and unstructured — enabling the company to identify defect trends much faster, include data from additional data sources, and achieve return on investment (ROI) in only 9 months.  Proven experience — DXC has delivered global Data Governance solutions to Fortune 500 companies in many industries, including our own organization, with a team dedicated to implementing Data Governance solutions and harnessing best practices.  Flexible delivery capability — With 95 data centers, 9,200 analytics consultants, >20 global and regional delivery centers, 6 digital transformation centers and 15+ years of experience, DXC truly has a global reach.  Technology independence — DXC has experience with leading Data Governance tools, including industry-specific tools, and can give unbiased direction in tool selection. We have partner relationships with leading vendors.  Comprehensive method — Our service is based on the DXC Hybrid Data Management Reference Architecture and DXC Global Method, a comprehensive approach to data governance with well-defined methods, accelerators and deliverables leading to consistent, quality delivery.  Holistic view of data governance — With our holistic view of data governance including strategic planning, enterprise and solution architecture, tool selection, implementation and integration, we look at the big picture according to customer needs, rather than taking a tool-based approach.  900+ analytics clients worldwide  9,200+ information management and business intelligence professionals around the world  More than 100 dedicated data scientists in global delivery centers  20+ years of analytics experience with Fortune 500 clients worldwide  >20 global and regional delivery centers In an era of rapidly advancing technology, big data and advanced analytics, and with new data regulations being implemented around the world, every organization must manage data governance. However, data governance challenges can stifle implementation and uptake. With the right framework, people and practices, organizations can implement a strategy and process to overcome data governance challenges. It can be difficult to set roles and built accountability for data in an organization that is siloed and has never had a company-wide strategy before. Maturity assessment services — approximately 2 weeks  Master planning services — approximately 2 to 3 months  Service Delivery ranges — 2 to 7 years  Tool selection — approximately 1 month  Proof of concept / pilot — 2 to 3 months  Solution implementation — 4 to 6 months; price and duration vary based on number of domains and complexity  Application management services — ongoing  Multiple pricing options are available, depending on the scale and complexity of a customer solution  CLIENT REGION INDUSTRY CLOSED/WON  Anglian Water Services Ltd UKIIMEA Energy Apr 2019 BAE Systems MA&I UKIIMEA Manufacturing Jun 2019 Dell EMC Americas CME & Tech Mar 2019 Grant Thornton LLP Americas Banking & Capital Markets Feb 2019 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company Americas CME & Tech Jun 2019 HP Inc. Americas CME & Tech Dec 2018 Mondelez International, Inc. Americas Consumer Industries & Retail Dec 2018 Sulzer AG N.C.Europe Manufacturing Jun 2019 United Continental Holdings, Inc. Americas Travel & Transportation Sep 2019 Taipei Fubon Asia Banking & Capital Markets May 2018 MINISTERO DELL’ISTRUZIONE, DELL’UNIVERSITA’ E DELLA RICERCA S. Europe Public Sector Feb 2019  Arrange a follow-up conversation with an SME and start the conversation with the top-of-mind pain points. Agree on objectives for data governance.  Explore data sources and their governance and compliance needs, and outline the future state.  Determine a high-level data governance model: people, policies, processes and tools; then build a roadmap for moving forward.

fields.meta_keywords: FirstDoc, EMC D2, NextDocs, OpenText, Veeva Vault
fields.meta_description: Delivering new levels of collaboration, efficiency and productivity
fields.page_body: Built on a best-in-class rules engine, FirstDoc streamlines the regulatory document management process while ensuring compliance with global regulatory authorities. Unlike other content management tools, FirstDoc was built for life sciences companies and has been optimized to support their particular business processes. New functionality lets users quickly search for and bookmark favorite documents and create collaboration spaces so that they can work more easily and efficiently with affiliates, business partners, and contract research organizations. Life sciences companies now have a more cost effective and efficient route to achieving compliance with complex regulatory and internal requirements. FirstDoc is the longest established market-leading electronic document management system (EDMS) designed for the life sciences industry. Offering a web-delivered, next-gen user experience — and also mobile capabilities that let busy users review and approve documents on the go — FirstDoc from DXC delivers high levels of collaboration, efficiency and productivity to the document management process for life sciences companies. Built on a best-in-class rules engine, FirstDoc streamlines the regulatory document management process and ensures compliance in a highly secure environment. FirstDoc was built for life sciences and is optimized to support the industry's unique business processes. Simple and personalDXC FirstDoc approaches the user experience from the regulatory professional's point of view. Efficient, effective compliance management—DXC FirstDoc ensures compliance through a proven, reliable rules engine that complies with 21 CFR Part 11 and global submission standards, and years of internal audit best practices. Improved productivity, flexibility and collaboration—DXC FirstDoc's strong yet flexible permissioning structure allows companies to define permissions broadly or at a very granular level. Reduced cost of ownership—DXC FirstDoc lets you do more with less. By removing unnecessary dependence on third-party software, FirstDoc reduces costs and minimizes the effort to retain certified, compliant environments. 15,000+ pharma products approved and managed 10 (of 11) global Fortune 500 pharma companies are DXC clients 11 (of 11) U.S. Fortune 500 pharma companies are DXC clients 65,000+ regulatory submissions, with zero refusals by regulatory authorities 250,000+ global users, largest market footprint 20+ years of experience in life sciences More than 400 DXC clients across the pharma, biotech, generics, medical distribution and medical device sectors Compliance with industry regulations for drug related documentation Secure Collaborative Review with Consistent Templates relevant to industry expectations Infrastructure cost reduction Regional applicability: All Sales Status: Sales Ready Existing Clients: 26 Average TCV: $500K Average contract length: Annual or Term based (3-5 years) Pricing models: (On-premise & Cloud models) T&M, SaaS) Average Sales Cycle: 16 Win Rate: 0.65    CLIENT  REGION  INDUSTRY  CLOSED/WON     AbbVie  Americas  Pharma  Jun 2012    Mundipharma  UKIIMEA  Pharma  Aug 2014    Boehringer-Ingelheim  NCE  Pharma  Mar 2017    Eisai  Asia  Pharma  Apr 2019    Shire  Americas  Pharma  Oct 2018   Share our DXC FirstDoc Offering Overview Schedule an introduction to DXC FirstDoc via a demonstration

fields.meta_keywords: healthcare, eligibility, solution, benefit, policy, enrollment, coverage, provider
fields.meta_description: The DXC Healthcare Eligibility Solution is a real-time, rules-based eligibility and benefit determination system that enables consistent policy application in support of real-time eligibility determination and enrollment.
fields.page_body: The DXC Healthcare Eligibility Solution enables citizens, through self-service, to apply for government-subsidized health coverage in a way similar to how insurance is selected in the commercial market. Citizens enter their household information, which is compared against a set of rules to determine if they qualify for a particular coverage. They apply online, review enrollment options, and select a physician or managed care provider in real time. This self-service capability also enables human services organizations to better manage the dramatic increase in enrollees and use resources more efficiently. This solution is built on a flexible and expandable service-oriented architecture that enables multiple access channels and service delivery models. It includes all core business and support functions necessary to manage the eligibility process. The application standardizes information sharing and improves integration of services across agency and program boundaries. The DXC Healthcare Eligibility Solution provides an automated, streamlined enrollment process designed specifically for public healthcare programs. The self-service access style increases participants' independence and ability to manage their own cases, and reduces reliance on face-to-face agency contact. Additional cost-savings this solution provides allows to do more with fewer people and smaller budgets. The DXC Healthcare Eligibility Solution is designed with flexibility, expandability, and accuracy in mind, and a user-maintained, rules-based approach provides consistent policy, supporting real-time eligibility and benefit determinations. All this is provided in an efficient near-real time process. DXC has 45+ years of experience. We have 8,000+ Health & Life Sciences IT services professionals. DXC Healthcare has full Utilization Review Accreditation Commission (URAC) Accreditation in health utilization management. Our differentiating intellectual property accelerates solution delivery and quality. We support state and local Health and Human Services (HHS) programs for 35 states and territories. DXC is the largest provider of Medicaid services in the United States. We are one of the largest Health & Life Sciences IT services providers in the world. We perform 2.4 billion healthcare transactions annually, including 1 billion in health claims. We have more than 45 years of healthcare industry experience. DXC Technology has more than 250 clinical professionals supporting our clients. DXC has implemented and operates the leading online, consumer-driven Medicaid eligibility determination system. Impact of Healthcare Reform—Reducing eligibility and increasing applicants' claims requires additional resources, claims processing. Rising costs—Continuing increase in cost to deliver healthcare services. Decreasing resources—Providing more services with fewer people; budget constraints requiring strict cost and resource optimization. Increased growth—Growing demand/need for public program services. Client Challenges—Improve the progressive movement of patients and information between departments, staff groups or healthcare organizations as part of a patient's care pathway to improve patient outcomes and reduce the cost of care. Demanding citizens—Responding to demands for quality healthcare services. Regional Availability—America only TCV—$50-500m Contract Length—5-10 years; typically structured as a 3-5 year base + 1-year options Implementation (DDI, TMO)—24-48 months (28-36 months is typical) Deal structure—Typically, a business process services deal supported with DXC technology products Pricing Model Fixed price DDI: deliverables based or time-based ($X per month) Operations: per claim, per beneficiary, per call (for call center), or fixed    CLIENT  REGION  INDUSTRY  CLOSED/WON     Oklahoma State Health Care Authority  Americas     Competition Deloitte—Deloitte is the market leader in eligibility solutions with a large installed base. Xerox—Xerox has a large footprint in Medicaid Management Information Systems (MMIS). Accenture—Accenture is making a strong play in the eligibility market. IBM—IBM has opportunity for growth in this space based on its Curam Software acquisition Share the offering overview with the client. Engage an Industry consultant to understand client requirements

fields.meta_keywords: microsoft dynamics 365, enterprise resource planning, erp, customer relationship management, crm, cloud, analytic capabilities, microsoft power bi
fields.meta_description: DXC Solutions for Microsoft Dynamics 365 bring together Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) cloud offerings into one cloud service with specific, purpose-built applications for key business processes.
fields.page_body: A new is now available. Learn how to engage in a conversation with your client on how they can transform to meet the needs of their customers. The emphasis is on Digital Transformation and the solutions that help our Retail clients create greater competitive advantage. Leverage the new to articulate to your client the opportunities that exist in transforming their customer engagement. This includes all of the functions that encompass customer service and support, and a detailed section on our Contact Center accelerator which provides leading technology for Digital Transformation of the Contact Center. Microsoft's suite of solutions for productivity, cloud, data, customer engagement, and operations enables end-to-end digital transformation across the entire enterprise. DXC Solutions for Microsoft Dynamics 365 brings together enterprise resource planning (ERP) and customer relationship management (CRM) cloud offerings into one cloud service with specific, purpose built applications for key business processes, such as sales, field service, operations, and customer service. Across multiple industries, DXC helps clients better manage their internal operations and engage with their customers. Our deep industry knowledge coupled with our preconfigured vertical industry solutions and accelerators enable us to assist clients with their digital transformation. Microsoft Dynamics 365 provides a complete business view from manufacturing to sales to service. It provides insight across the entire customer life cycle allowing delivery of personalized experiences across all channels. Intelligent and automated processes accelerate the speed of business. Robust analytic capabilities, supported by Microsoft Power BI, provide actionable insight to continuously optimize business. Optimize operations: DXC was engaged to replace a legacy retail management system for a leading pharmacy retailer with over 400 stores. A unified solution was designed and implemented that manages the full retail operation.  Improve customer engagement: Implementation of new case management, contact center, and citizen portal solution by a government agency improved the delivery of services and enhanced citizen engagement.  Increase revenue: Modernization of a loan process origination solution for a large bank in Australia resulted in a seven-day loan origination process being reduced to one hour. This enabled the bank to increase market share in  the competitive mortgage lending market and to recognize revenue sooner.  Expertise: Expertise: DXC has over 50 years of experience as a global systems integrator and services over 6000 clients in 70 countries.  End-to-end services: DXC is the only vendor that delivers the full life cycle of cloud professional services: advisory, transformation, integration, and management.  Safe pair of hands: The DXC Microsoft Dynamics Practice has over 6000 clients and a 95% client retention rate.  Microsoft partnership: DXC is the #1 partner globally for Dynamics 365, has a 30+ year partnership with Microsoft, has been an Inner Circle winner for 19 years in a row, and has received numerous other awards from Microsoft over the years including the Global Microsoft Dynamics Partner of the year.  Speed-to-value: DXC can solve your critical business issues quickly and with minimal risk with our industry products and accelerators built on Microsoft Dynamics 365.  #1 Dynamics 365 partner globally  2550+ dedicated Dynamics resources worldwide  95% customer retention rate  6000+ Dynamics clients  1000+ Microsoft certifications  Dynamics Inner Circle winner 19 years in a row According to Gartner, Inc., "Digital business will change the economic models of your industry."1 Digital disruption is the largest challenge facing enterprises today. To remain relevant, companies must develop strategies to transform to a  new style of business. Emerging technologies are enabling digital business innovation. To remain competitive, enterprises must reimagine how they interact with customers, manufacture products, manage their supply chain, sell and deliver services,  and drive out cost. 1 Gartner. Building and Expanding a Digital Business Primer for 2017, January 2017. Implementation—Engagement duration varies based on scope and complexity of project: typically ranges from 6 to 36 months  Project—Advisory Services followed by DXC Solutions for Microsoft Dynamics 365  TCV—Price is variable based on scale and complexity of the project and ranges between $1M and $20M  Pricing models—Fixed price or time and materials based on estimated resource plan and standard billing rates  Regional availability—Offering can be delivered worldwide using our regional and global delivery teams      Client   Region   Industry   Closed/Won      Walmart   Americas   Retail   2019     Gough Group   ANZ   Transportation   2019     Metropolitan Museum of Art   Americas   Retail   2019     Twilfit AB   N.C. Solutions—Leverage our global delivery centers to build the right solution.

fields.meta_keywords: patient, care suite, clinic, clinical, admission, discharge, coding
fields.meta_description: DXC Lorenzo is a Healthcare Next-Generation Electronic Patient Record (EPR) for Integrated Patient Care.
fields.page_body: The offering provides robust and scalable core functions essential for broad and deep patient management such as admission, transfer, discharge, clinical and administrative management, statutory/legislative reporting, bed management and clinical coding. Lorenzo improves efficient collaboration in and between care teams and ensures sensitive patient data is protected at all times. DXC Lorenzo is currently sold as part of DXC Care Suite which extends the EPR with solutions to efficiently engage patients (Patient Aide), new apps for clinical users (Personas), organize care delivery across organizations (DXC Health360) and a new data platform that provides intelligence, orchestration and automation (DXC Open Health Connect). Features/Services and Deliverables Care Management Details & Features Deliverable  Identity Management Patient Registration with the ability for full real-time integration/synchronization to a national patient database. Patient can be registered as part of electronic referrals or electronic appointment systems. Management of all aspects of a person's identity and demographic information. Patient Death information management within and across organization boundaries. Patient record merge and unmerging in and across organization boundaries.  Referral Management and Referral to Treatment Monitoring Recording and management of all types of inbound referral information and notifications. Generation and management of outbound referral information and notifications. Comprehensive capability for monitoring Referral to Treatment and cancer waits. This facilitates the monitoring capability for the patient treatment processes. Support for electronic inbound and outbound referrals.  Scheduling Management Capability for the detailed planning, scheduling and monitoring of capacity requirements for treatment processes in and across inpatient, outpatient and day healthcare settings. Comprehensive support for patient choice, suspensions and preferences through the offer process. Comprehensive business rule definitions support nationally and locally defined monitoring requirements.  Treatment Delivery Flexible configuration and comprehensive rule definition provides easy management of clinics, clinic resources, sessions and slots. Effective management of outpatient bookings including electronic booking services. Effective management of inpatient bookings including pre-admission clinic attendance. Flexible ward definition and configuration including full bed management models. Graphical Ward view and comprehensive ward management including patient transfers, discharges and ward attendances. Support for boarders to be admitted alongside patients. Support for Critical Care Period management. Support for formal and informal patient leave, including integration with UK Mental Health Act (MHA) functionality. Clinical Documentation Details & Features Deliverable  Electronic Health record viewer Complete patient record, presented in several axes, depending on user needs and context. Timeline View to put the patient record in time perspective. Journal view to present the patient record in list view navigation tools to browse through the patient record. Clinician Preview Pane (CPP) for a flexible, widget-based presentation of information from the patient record. It allows the user to initiate Lorenzo Care activities directly from a Widget in CPP.  Clinical Documentation Clinical Narrative Services functionality enables users to record clinical notes, to use form-based documents (such as assessments), to create clinical correspondence, and to record specific types of clinical data. Clinical Narrative Services comprises three key areas of functionality: Forms (also known as Clinical Data Capture or CDC) Clinical Noting Clinical Statements such as Health Issues and Procedures/Interventions  Requests and Results Full physician order entry and result viewing. Provides care and cure planning. Orders can be placed from everywhere in the physician's workflow to prevent extra navigation. Supports combined order sets (Care Sets) and allows for nearly one-click orders. Result viewing: results can be presented in the context of the request to improve health record consistency. Tabular views enable easy viewing of numeric results at a glance with result trends in context. This provides early detection of patient deterioration.  Clinical Chart Clinical Charts provide a logical grouping of forms, notes and letters that is meaningful for a specific clinical role in a specific clinical setting. It allows for reading forms, notes and letters without any navigation. New care activities can be launched from a chart. Patient information is not duplicated in Clinical Charts, these display the right documentation in the right context. Information from the patient record can appear in multiple charts. This improves multi-disciplinary care and reduces navigation. A chart displays icons to inform the user about new results, open tasks, open documents, open care plans and alerts.  Health Issues and Problem-Oriented Medical record Allergies, advanced directives, Alerts and problems are centrally managed in the patient record. The user is informed about recorded allergies, alerts, and advanced directives via icons in the patient banner, patient list and Clinical Chart.  Observation chart with Fluid balance Fluid Balance is a critical tool for monitoring and maintaining patients correct amount of fluid in the body, as Fluid Balance can alter quickly with disease or illness It supports monitoring and maintaining patient's correct physiological status. Both nurses and clinicians can document observations for a patient to view short and long term trends based on the data recorded.  Medication prescription and administration Comprehensive prescription of medication. Efficient, single prescriptions for tapered doses, locally-manufactured items, order sets, and fixed or variable rate infusions. Drug history and reconciliation Clinical Decision Support. ePMA, underpinned by nationally recognized medication knowledge repositories, checks if the prescription is suitable for the patient. It checks a series of parameters, like dose, conflicting allergies against patient characteristics. Clinical Decision Support. Care Suite ePMA, underpinned by nationally recognized medication knowledge repositories, checks if the prescription is suitable for the patient. It checks a series of parameters, like dose, conflicting allergies against patient characteristics. Medications can be searched for by name, common synonyms, or by locally tailored indexes. Formulary medications are presented first to highlight preferred choices. Pharmacy Workflow. Prescriptions are transmitted to the pharmacist worklist for expert checking. Patients due for discharge are highlighted to aid prioritization. Ward medication stock lists can be viewed and requests for supplies from are generated for dispensing by pharmacy  UK-Specific Regulatory Considerations To support key government guidance from NICE and the Care Commissioning Board, correct and complete observations are needed to monitor for signs of patient deterioration with support of an escalation protocol and observation schedule for continual monitoring. Patient Banner Patient lists Task management Clinical Content Starter set Clinical coding Mental Health Details & Features Deliverable  Registration Patient Registration with full real-time synchronization to national patient databases such as the UK Patient Demographic Service, including temporary registrations Management of all aspects of a person’s identity, including the ability to identifying duplicate records Full support for recording deceased information both within and across organization boundaries Full support for Merge/Unmerge both within and across organizational boundaries.  Referral Management Support for recording and management of inbound referrals both in paper and electronic formats Generation of outbound referral information to support onward management of patient care Comprehensive configuration capability for the recording and monitoring of RTT and PPI processes Full support for responding to and meeting the full range of Department of Health as well as locally defined targets.  Access Planning Provides the capability to manage detailed planning, scheduling and monitoring of capacity requirements for a given treatment process, service, care provider or team. Customer definition of access plans.  Outpatient/community clinic booking and scheduling Flexible configuration for easy management of clinics, resources, sessions, slots and rule definition Restructuring and rescheduling processes in accordance with locally defined operational processes Creation and management of outpatient bookings through diaries, directly or access plans Comprehensive support for the location, reservation and scheduling of outpatient appointments.  Contact Management Flexibility and capability for scheduling single, multiple and recurring patient/non-patient-based contacts for individuals or multiple attendees, such as patients and caregivers.  Case Note Tracking Integrated support for tracking patient documentation through volume creation and management. Inpatient bed-management Comprehensive support for Inpatient admissions including admissions under the UK Mental Health Act Flexible ward definition, including ward level, hybrid and full bed management models Comprehensive support for ward management including patient location swaps, transfers and discharges, and patient ward attendances. The ability to admit an unlimited number of patients to a full ward and accurately reflect occupancy figures across all bed management scenarios Graphical Ward View giving a top-down view of wards, with the ability to transfer patients using drag and drop, supporting real-time ADT.  Mental Health Act Administration Ability to record against the patient record full details of any application of the UK MHA 2007 Recording new Sections, renewing existing Sections and converting one Section to another All of the rules for each Section, as defined by the Act, are pre-defined and built into Lorenzo. This includes not only basic information such as durations, renewal periods and legal forms but also detailed rules pertaining to applicant types, outcomes, places of safety and restrictions as well as comprehensive validation rules to ensure only permissible Sections can co-exist.  Alerts and Warnings, Consent to Treatment Recording of the consent to treatment provisions of Part IV of the UK Mental Health Act  Patient Reviews Further support is available to provide effective care coordination with the delivery of specific functionality in support of care plan reviews within the UK Care Programme Approach (CPA) Support for Care plans through the use of Assessments Review management functionality working as a bridge to Mental Health Act administration, statutory policy and the clinical responsibilities of those providing care to the patient under the Act and framework of CPA  DXC Lorenzo provides a single integrated, future-proof, highly structured EPR that supports the very best patient care. Its process-driven approach delivers benefits to healthcare professionals, organizations and patients, connecting the entire healthcare network and supporting improved quality, efficiency and cost savings. Future-Proof, Secure, Hosted Healthcare IT Environments Lorenzo's rich functionality and open architecture creates a highly flexible healthcare IT environment. Lorenzo helps customers to stay focused on the core business of healthcare and its triple aim to realize better care for individuals, better health for populations and lower cost per capita. An integrated approach towards healthcare reform: One enabling technology infrastructure to facilitate care: Built from scratch to rigorous UK NHS specifications Highly scalable & configurable Cost-effective scaling and configuring Improve data capture and access to support business processes Secure access to sensitive data, that is protected across the solution Upgrade and data migration with virtually no downtime Clients will see improvements in the following areas: Improved Clinical Outcomes: Make more fully informed decisions and prioritize care. Efficient referral triage Quicker access to better-quality clinical information Collaborate more effectively during care episodes Improved patient safety and patient confidentiality Continuous quality and efficiency improvements Greater patient involvement in their own care Treatment progress and wait-time monitoring Increased Operational Efficiency: Enter information once and re-use it many times Increased communication/availability of information across sites Improve turnaround of requests and results, referrals Spend less time interpreting handwritten notes and requests Improve record-keeping and information auditing Streamline processes through optimized clinical workflow Enhanced Performance: Access to richer, clinical and business information. Create an agile workforce and professional service Improve communication and collaboration between technology and clinicians Improved cost-effectiveness: Reduce outpatient DNAs (Did Not Attends) Reduce the length of inpatient stay Lower medication spending through electronic prescribing Enhance care planning: Eliminate duplicate tests and other activities Avoid treatment incurred medical complication Leading the way with digital health platforms — DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Proven product for market — Product is proven and referenceable within the market. Product is deployed and live at a number of healthcare organizations across UK NHS. Lorenzo has been sold within the ANZ market. DXC can deliver 99% availability, zero data loss, and zero downtime for upgrades increasing patient and hospital staff satisfaction. To secure better clinical outcomes Client Challenges: Success for hospital providers is defined by achieving the best possible clinical outcome for each patient. Currently this is a challenge as full information about a patient's treatment and their care pathway may not be available to all treating clinicians and supporting staff, leading to poor decisions and deviations from best practice. There is also a need to comply with an ever-increasing range of targets and quality measures. Current State: Healthcare records are still largely paper-based, which constrains where and when healthcare can be delivered. Desired Future State: Information about a patient's treatment and care pathway available easily so all treating clinicians can understand the case and conform to best practice. DXC Answer: DXC Lorenzo replaces paper by collecting information about a patient into a single comprehensive Electronic Patient Record (EPR) which gives everyone involved in the delivery of care to that patient access to all the information they need, regardless of where they are located. Lorenzo improves the quality of information captured by enabling information to be captured at the point of care delivery. Lorenzo gives administrators and clinicians the tools to record patient information in real time. This information can be captured using structured forms and prepared responses. Using this information Lorenzo already generates some 200 plus standard reports but also provides users with the ability to build their own reporting systems. Build and maintain a reputation for delivering excellent healthcare Client Challenges: Clinical negligence cases continue to rise due to avoidable mistakes in hospitals. In a market that is increasingly seeing hospitals competing with each other for patients, it is important that the service is seen to be good for both referring GPs and patients. Current State: Mistakes happen in hospitals, often due to poor information availability which prompts contra-indicated prescribing and treatment. Poor communication with related health professionals regarding the patient care pathway/treatment discourages referrals. Desired Future State: A clear record of all treatment for clinicians and automatic alerts for repeat or contra-indicated medication prescribing and administration reduces mistakes. Instant production of treatment records for related health professionals ensures good communications and encourages repeat referrals. DXC Answer: Many of the problems with mistakes in hospitals stem from the use of handwritten, paper-based systems. The replacement of handwritten notes and prescribing forms with a legible, secure electronic record will reduce simple errors. Lorenzo Clinical Documentation and Lorenzo Prescribing does this. With patient information in electronic form clinicians can be supported with decision support systems to ensure that simple errors such as dose miscalculation, drug-to-drug reactions and allergies can be flagged by the system. One of the most common complaints from patients is that they are asked the same question over and over again as they progress through their stay in a hospital. Lorenzo prevents this via an integrated system that captures information once and makes it available to whoever needs it. It is common for patients to be subjected to multiple repeated and unnecessary tests. Lorenzo's Requests and Results automatically check for duplicate tests. Lorenzo uses Clinical Documentation to generate immediate discharge summaries which are both comprehensive and available whenever a patient is discharged. Reducing costs Client Challenges: Healthcare organizations are under significant budget constraints as the cost of healthcare continues to rise. Current State: Some hospitals are still largely run on paper-based systems. This means that information is captured on paper and then often keyed into a computer system later by administrative staff. This is inefficient in a number of ways: It requires administrative staff to capture information at additional cost Paper is sometimes lost, resulting in some activity not being recorded and, therefore, not billed Information is sometimes transcribed incorrectly, thereby leading to incorrect billing. Desired Future State: Integrated patient record captured at point of care. DXC Answer: DXC Lorenzo provides a single integrated information source that enables hospitals to change their business process to ensure that information is being captured electronically in real time. Note: DXC Lorenzo is currently sold as part of the DXC Care Suite. Target Market: ANZ, Central Europe, Nordics , and UKI Average TCV: $6M – $15M Primary Buyer: Combination of C–level Executives CEO and CIO of the health organizations. Please contact the Offering Manager listed in the contacts section for latest information on client wins. Competition The broad scope of an EPR system means that competition exists in a number of functional domains, such as PAS, Clinicals and Clinical Documentation systems. AllScripts Sunrise Acute Care: Clinicals focused product. Cerner Millenium: Highly mature and clinically rich solution delivered in a number of markets including the UK as part of the NPfIT programme. Mature product with good referenceability and large customer base especially in US. Cerner acquired the Siemens Healthcare IT activities in 2014 (including Soarian). EPIC EpicCare: Highly successful large US EPR provider with reputation for rich clinical functionality, but also for being expensive. Deals won due to rich functionality, complete clinical content and good referencability. Epic tends to contract only large healthcare organizations. Harris CareFX: Harris-CareFX's patient and clinician portal platform provides integrated clinical record. McKesson Medway (& others): Marketing System C's Medway product as replacement for TotalCare. Other offerings are XCare and Horizon. Share the offering overview and presetn client presenation to key stakeholder. Schedule a demonstration.
