Outpatient/community clinic booking and scheduling Flexible configuration for easy management of clinics, resources, sessions, slots and rule definition Restructuring and rescheduling processes in accordance with locally defined operational processes Creation and management of outpatient bookings through diaries, directly or access plans Comprehensive support for the location, reservation and scheduling of outpatient appointments.  Contact Management Flexibility and capability for scheduling single, multiple and recurring patient/non-patient-based contacts for individuals or multiple attendees, such as patients and caregivers.  Case Note Tracking Integrated support for tracking patient documentation through volume creation and management. Inpatient bed-management Comprehensive support for Inpatient admissions including admissions under the UK Mental Health Act Flexible ward definition, including ward level, hybrid and full bed management models Comprehensive support for ward management including patient location swaps, transfers and discharges, and patient ward attendances. The ability to admit an unlimited number of patients to a full ward and accurately reflect occupancy figures across all bed management scenarios Graphical Ward View giving a top-down view of wards, with the ability to transfer patients using drag and drop, supporting real-time ADT.  Mental Health Act Administration Ability to record against the patient record full details of any application of the UK MHA 2007 Recording new Sections, renewing existing Sections and converting one Section to another All of the rules for each Section, as defined by the Act, are pre-defined and built into Lorenzo. This includes not only basic information such as durations, renewal periods and legal forms but also detailed rules pertaining to applicant types, outcomes, places of safety and restrictions as well as comprehensive validation rules to ensure only permissible Sections can co-exist.  Alerts and Warnings, Consent to Treatment Recording of the consent to treatment provisions of Part IV of the UK Mental Health Act  Patient Reviews Further support is available to provide effective care coordination with the delivery of specific functionality in support of care plan reviews within the UK Care Programme Approach (CPA) Support for Care plans through the use of Assessments Review management functionality working as a bridge to Mental Health Act administration, statutory policy and the clinical responsibilities of those providing care to the patient under the Act and framework of CPA  DXC Lorenzo provides a single integrated, future-proof, highly structured EPR that supports the very best patient care. Its process-driven approach delivers benefits to healthcare professionals, organizations and patients, connecting the entire healthcare network and supporting improved quality, efficiency and cost savings. Future-Proof, Secure, Hosted Healthcare IT Environments Lorenzo's rich functionality and open architecture creates a highly flexible healthcare IT environment. Lorenzo helps customers to stay focused on the core business of healthcare and its triple aim to realize better care for individuals, better health for populations and lower cost per capita. An integrated approach towards healthcare reform: One enabling technology infrastructure to facilitate care: Built from scratch to rigorous UK NHS specifications Highly scalable & configurable Cost-effective scaling and configuring Improve data capture and access to support business processes Secure access to sensitive data, that is protected across the solution Upgrade and data migration with virtually no downtime Clients will see improvements in the following areas: Improved Clinical Outcomes: Make more fully informed decisions and prioritize care. Efficient referral triage Quicker access to better-quality clinical information Collaborate more effectively during care episodes Improved patient safety and patient confidentiality Continuous quality and efficiency improvements Greater patient involvement in their own care Treatment progress and wait-time monitoring Increased Operational Efficiency: Enter information once and re-use it many times Increased communication/availability of information across sites Improve turnaround of requests and results, referrals Spend less time interpreting handwritten notes and requests Improve record-keeping and information auditing Streamline processes through optimized clinical workflow Enhanced Performance: Access to richer, clinical and business information. Create an agile workforce and professional service Improve communication and collaboration between technology and clinicians Improved cost-effectiveness: Reduce outpatient DNAs (Did Not Attends) Reduce the length of inpatient stay Lower medication spending through electronic prescribing Enhance care planning: Eliminate duplicate tests and other activities Avoid treatment incurred medical complication Leading the way with digital health platforms — DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Proven product for market — Product is proven and referenceable within the market. Product is deployed and live at a number of healthcare organizations across UK NHS. Lorenzo has been sold within the ANZ market. DXC can deliver 99% availability, zero data loss, and zero downtime for upgrades increasing patient and hospital staff satisfaction. To secure better clinical outcomes Client Challenges: Success for hospital providers is defined by achieving the best possible clinical outcome for each patient. Currently this is a challenge as full information about a patient's treatment and their care pathway may not be available to all treating clinicians and supporting staff, leading to poor decisions and deviations from best practice. There is also a need to comply with an ever-increasing range of targets and quality measures. Current State: Healthcare records are still largely paper-based, which constrains where and when healthcare can be delivered. Desired Future State: Information about a patient's treatment and care pathway available easily so all treating clinicians can understand the case and conform to best practice. DXC Answer: DXC Lorenzo replaces paper by collecting information about a patient into a single comprehensive Electronic Patient Record (EPR) which gives everyone involved in the delivery of care to that patient access to all the information they need, regardless of where they are located. Lorenzo improves the quality of information captured by enabling information to be captured at the point of care delivery. Lorenzo gives administrators and clinicians the tools to record patient information in real time. This information can be captured using structured forms and prepared responses. Using this information Lorenzo already generates some 200 plus standard reports but also provides users with the ability to build their own reporting systems. Build and maintain a reputation for delivering excellent healthcare Client Challenges: Clinical negligence cases continue to rise due to avoidable mistakes in hospitals. In a market that is increasingly seeing hospitals competing with each other for patients, it is important that the service is seen to be good for both referring GPs and patients. Current State: Mistakes happen in hospitals, often due to poor information availability which prompts contra-indicated prescribing and treatment. Poor communication with related health professionals regarding the patient care pathway/treatment discourages referrals. Desired Future State: A clear record of all treatment for clinicians and automatic alerts for repeat or contra-indicated medication prescribing and administration reduces mistakes. Instant production of treatment records for related health professionals ensures good communications and encourages repeat referrals. DXC Answer: Many of the problems with mistakes in hospitals stem from the use of handwritten, paper-based systems. The replacement of handwritten notes and prescribing forms with a legible, secure electronic record will reduce simple errors. Lorenzo Clinical Documentation and Lorenzo Prescribing does this. With patient information in electronic form clinicians can be supported with decision support systems to ensure that simple errors such as dose miscalculation, drug-to-drug reactions and allergies can be flagged by the system. One of the most common complaints from patients is that they are asked the same question over and over again as they progress through their stay in a hospital. Lorenzo prevents this via an integrated system that captures information once and makes it available to whoever needs it. It is common for patients to be subjected to multiple repeated and unnecessary tests. Lorenzo's Requests and Results automatically check for duplicate tests. Lorenzo uses Clinical Documentation to generate immediate discharge summaries which are both comprehensive and available whenever a patient is discharged. Reducing costs Client Challenges: Healthcare organizations are under significant budget constraints as the cost of healthcare continues to rise. Current State: Some hospitals are still largely run on paper-based systems. This means that information is captured on paper and then often keyed into a computer system later by administrative staff. This is inefficient in a number of ways: It requires administrative staff to capture information at additional cost Paper is sometimes lost, resulting in some activity not being recorded and, therefore, not billed Information is sometimes transcribed incorrectly, thereby leading to incorrect billing. Desired Future State: Integrated patient record captured at point of care. DXC Answer: DXC Lorenzo provides a single integrated information source that enables hospitals to change their business process to ensure that information is being captured electronically in real time. Note: DXC Lorenzo is currently sold as part of the DXC Care Suite. Target Market: ANZ, Central Europe, Nordics , and UKI Average TCV: $6M – $15M Primary Buyer: Combination of C–level Executives CEO and CIO of the health organizations. Please contact the Offering Manager listed in the contacts section for latest information on client wins. Competition The broad scope of an EPR system means that competition exists in a number of functional domains, such as PAS, Clinicals and Clinical Documentation systems. AllScripts Sunrise Acute Care: Clinicals focused product. Cerner Millenium: Highly mature and clinically rich solution delivered in a number of markets including the UK as part of the NPfIT programme. Mature product with good referenceability and large customer base especially in US. Cerner acquired the Siemens Healthcare IT activities in 2014 (including Soarian). EPIC EpicCare: Highly successful large US EPR provider with reputation for rich clinical functionality, but also for being expensive. Deals won due to rich functionality, complete clinical content and good referencability. Epic tends to contract only large healthcare organizations. Harris CareFX: Harris-CareFX's patient and clinician portal platform provides integrated clinical record. McKesson Medway (& others): Marketing System C's Medway product as replacement for TotalCare. Other offerings are XCare and Horizon. Share the offering overview and presetn client presenation to key stakeholder. Schedule a demonstration.

fields.meta_keywords: webPAS, AllScripts, Cerner Millennium, EPIC, InterSystems(TrakHealth), Meditech, Orion Health
fields.meta_description: DXC web Patient Administration System (webPAS) is a Healthcare Patient Administration System (PAS) targeted for the Asia-Pacific markets.
fields.page_body: The offering provides robust and scalable core functions essential for broad and deep patient management such as admission, transfer, discharge, clinical and administrative management, statutory/legislative reporting, bed management and clinical coding. Fully integrated Departmental functions support of all aspects of patient flow and include: Inpatients Theatre Outpatients Accident and Emergency Patient Billing & Receipting Waiting List Mental Health Community Referrals Management Medical Record Tracking Diagnostic Results & Requests Forms Toolkit Clinical Notes & Documents Mobility Suite webPAS is a fully browser based, easy to use, patient centric solution providing multi-facility views of patient information across the continuum of care. The presentation and accessibility of Departmental information is supportive stakeholder workflow and improved quality of care. Clients can buy modules as they are required, small hospitals purchase the basic inpatient kit, with PMI, Inpatients, Coding and Billing. As they grow they can add Theatre and Appointment Scheduling and then expand into Emergency if applicable. For healthcare organizations in Asia Pacific, who have needs in managing their patient, clinical, business, and financial processes to make it easy to access patient information at the point of patient care. webPAS provides scalable core functions essential for broad and deep patient management such as admission, transfer, discharge, clinical and administrative management, statutory/legislative reporting, bed management and clinical coding. The result is a 99% availability, zero data loss, and zero downtime for upgrades increasing patient and hospital staff satisfaction. The product includes a Mobility Suite that takes a veneer of functionality (services) from across our broader product function set for presentation on mobile devices ensuring required clinical information is available from a single source, anywhere at any time in a format supportive of clinical workflow. Leading the way with digital health platforms—DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Proven product for market—Product is proven and referenceable within the market. Product is deployed and live at a number of healthcare organizations across ANZ. DXC can deliver 99% availability, zero data loss, and zero downtime for upgrades increasing patient and hospital staff satisfaction. Improving efficiency Client Challenges—Solution must work in a regional/state-wide context. Current State—Some existing solutions only deal with single or small groups of organizations. Desired Future State—True regional/state-wide implementations with efficiency gains in support/maintenance and processes. DXC Answer—DXC web Patient Administration System (webPAS) has been developed to allow multiple hospitals within one organization or site to operate from one instance. Reducing costs Client Challenges—Improve the progressive movement of patients and information between departments, staff groups or healthcare organizations as part of a patient's care pathway to improve patient outcomes and reduce the cost of care. Current State—Inability to see information or schedule patient journeys across departments, staff groups and healthcare organizations. Desired Future State—Coordinated and timely care supportive of a care pathway; Improved health outcomes; and Reduced length of stay. DXC Answer—The fully integrated modules of Bed management, eAdmissions portal, Theatre, Emergency and Waiting List in DXC webPAS via a multi-hospital/multi-campus environment provides single source access and management of information relevant to the specific care needs of each individual patient. Improving efficiency Client Challenges—Accessibility to a single patient record/EMR. Current State—Inability to see information across departments, staff groups or healthcare organizations. Desired Future State—Workflow and time efficiency gained through single activity versus multiple repetitions. Improved clinical decision making via complete information available for consideration; Reduced delay in initiating treatments and Test results immediately available to clinician. Clinical information is delivered immediately and directly into the clinician's hands supporting clinical workflow, informed decision making and faster time to treatment thus improving quality of care, health outcomes and reducing length of stay. DXC Answer—DXC web Patient Administration System (webPAS) can be deployed as a single instance within a region/state which enables collaboration and sharing of information and processes. Furthermore, the Mobility Suite provides clinicians with a window into their patients records, unifying both clinical and logistical information sourced from multiple underlying systems. Target market—Asia Pacific Primary buyer—Combination of C-level Executives CEO and CIO of the health organizations    CLIENT  REGION  INDUSTRY  CLOSED/WON          Competition External competitors include; AllScripts, Cerner, EPIC, InterSystems, Meditech and Orion Health. Schedule an introduction to DXC web Patient Administration System (webPAS) via a demonstration

fields.meta_keywords: healthcare, health, life science, sciences, patient, care, digital, health, platform
fields.meta_description: Creating connected healthcare economies.
fields.page_body: DXC Enterprise Management offers a future-proof IT roadmap for organizations that demand the highest possible performance, availability and return on investment from their information systems. DXC Enterprise Management is supported using the DXC Digital Health Platform, which offers the combined benefits of the software, services, security, and integration components to digitally transform healthcare and life science organizations while improving the accuracy and quality of patient care. DXC Enterprise Management proves to be the best Health Information System solution to build a well-informed health care provision model. DXC Enterprise Management is an enterprise health information system that connects everything from patient demographics to clinical data and financial reports. It delivers information exactly where it's needed and helps to create connections between each part of the healthcare web, delivering information where it's needed, at the right time. Open and flexible, DXC Enterprise Management is also compatible with all DXC Care Suite components, and this means that DXC Enterprise Management can be deployed alongside complementary technologies, in line with existing software roadmaps. Healthcare institutions worldwide are under pressure to deliver healthcare faster and more cost-effectively. Aging populations and chronic illnesses are stretching existing resources to their limits. DXC Enterprise Management proves to be the best Health Information System solution to build a well-informed health care provision model. Enterprise care providers are becoming larger and more geographically dispersed, encompassing care institutions of various types and sizes. DXC Enterprise Management supports multi-tenancy solution model proved to cater from 100 to 3000 bedded hospitals. DXC Enterprise Management solution caters to both public and private sector healthcare systems and proves useful to a wider range of users like Government officials, Healthcare business decision-makers, Clinicians, IT managers etc. DXC Enterprise Management seamlessly links disparate sites and workflows for institutions of all sizes, from small clinics to large research hospitals. It includes dedicated management modules for outpatient clinics, daycare organizations, emergency departments, inpatient wards, and mortuaries. This ensures that health practitioners have the right information to do their jobs. It helps professionals, including managers, to work more effectively and efficiently in almost every healthcare setting.  Ministry of Health Brunei creates a “One Patient / One Record” e-Health system by rolling out the Brunei Health Information and Management System (Bru-HIMS), built on DXC’s Enterprise Management system to link and integrate four hospitals and 60 health centers and clinics.Source  King Abdullah University Hospital is Jordan's first fully computerized hospital by using DXC Enterprise Management to provide end to end services, reduce costs, improve patient care and serve nearly 1 million local residentsSource  Ain Al Khaleej Hospital in United Arab Emirates achieves HIMSS EMRAM Stage 6 certification using DXC Enterprise ManagementSourceVideo  Mouwasat Medical Services, Saudi Arabia achieves HIMSS EMRAM Stage 6 certification in 2018 using DXC Enterprise ManagementSource Healthcare institutions worldwide are under pressure to deliver healthcare faster and more cost-effectively. Aging populations and chronic illnesses are stretching existing resources to their limits. The healthcare industry has undergone a paradigm shift to patient-centered care – caring for patients on the whole including their medical, financial and social health. Patients have become active participants in their care management instead of passive recipients. Rather than allowing their care teams to dictate their care, patients now expect continued support and guidance at each step of their own healthcare journey. DXC Enterprise Management supports digital transformation for institutions of varying types and sizes, from Nation-wide or Provincial deployments to large research-led hospitals distributed across wide geographies and single healthcare entities. This is achieved with a range of modular components that are web-based and scalable for enterprise-wide implementation with robust backend technology. Add-ons include mobility solutions, ERP interfacing for procurement & financials, HR, data analytics and role-based systems of engagement. DXC Enterprise Management is suitable for health economies at various stages of development. Advanced multi-lingual support means the solution functions across geographical boundaries especially targeted for AMEA region. DXC Enterprise Management offers comprehensive customization features that allow users to display and manipulate information in a way that is most valuable to them. Deal profiles: From $1.5M over 3 years for a small provider with only the HIS and Mobility solution to over $10M for large HIE type solutions (with OHC solution) across Asia and Middle East region and key add on solutions like H360, Vitae and MS Dynamics Initial Implementation Phase – Patient-Driven Care Workshop — 2 to 3 months Identify client expectations, pain points and improvement opportunities; specify capability requirements and initiatives required to design the ideal patient journey, together with business cases and road-maps based on a prioritized list of initiatives. Subsequent Implementation Phase — 6 to 12 months. Leverage DXC Digital Transformation capabilities and product pull-through opportunities. For example, implementation of DXC Healthcare technology platform components, such as Healthcare Cloud, Open Health Connect, Health 360, PatientAide, and Care Personas. Run phase as a managed service — multi-year Sales cycle and deal value — Likely 6 to 9 months sales cycle; the average deal value can be in the $8M range Pricing Models — Ask for the detailed pricing models Regional Availability — Asia, Middle East, Africa (AMEA) region Average Sales Cycle: 16 months Win Rate: 0.65  CLIENT REGION INDUSTRY CLOSED/WON  Artemis Health Sciences, New Delhi, India – 2 Hospitals India Healthcare and Life Sciences Dec 2007 Medanta, Medicity, 1 Hospital Live in New Delhi, India + 5 New Hospitals in multiple cities) India Healthcare and Life Sciences Aug 2008 Sri Satya Sai Hospital, Bangalore & Puttaparthi, India (2 Hospitals) India Healthcare and Life Sciences Aug 2002 AMRI, Kolkata, India – 6 Hospitals India Healthcare and Life Sciences June 2010 Kokilaben Dhirubai Ambani Hospital, Mumbai, India (1 Hospital is Live + 1 New Hospital) India Healthcare and Life Sciences July 2011 Nahdi Medical Company, Saudi Arabia – Chain of Clinics (Implementation in progress) Middle East Healthcare and Life Sciences Mar 2018  Share our DXC Enterprise Management Offering Overview Schedule an introduction to DXC Enterprise Management via a demonstration

fields.meta_keywords: pathology process, macroscopic, microscopic, patient, anatomy, registration, results, reports
fields.meta_description: DXC PAT-Win is DXC`s Anatomy Pathology Solution for Southern Europe and Latin America.
fields.page_body: DXC PAT-Win spans the entire pathology process from registering samples as they arrive, specifying and documenting the macroscopic and microscopic descriptions and observations, and then generating outputs including printing and cost control. DXC PAT-Win is easily integrated with other information systems. The solution receives requests from other applications directly; this relieves the pathology service from performing tasks such as samples and patient registration, thereby improving the quality of management and reducing errors in transcription and interpretation. PAT-Win also sends the results (reports) automatically, either to the requesting application or to an independent application. DXC PAT-Win is organized into processes aimed at easily controlling the input and use of data, allowing the control and exhaustive processing of the information within the busy working environment of Pathology departments. DXC PAT-Win enables detailed and accurate recording of all laboratory activities ensuring efficiency and safety. Extensive and meaningful audit data allows laboratory performance to be monitored and analyzed to enable best practice and LEAN workflows. Because PAT-Win is adapted to users' work styles through a wide range of configurable functions, it can support all the daily tasks of a pathology service smoothly and easily. For example, samples that arrive at a Pathology department can be registered using different techniques. Macrocospic and microscopic descriptions and observations can be specified and diagnostic results assigned. Outputs can then be generated, reports can be printed, and costs can be controlled. Leading the way with digital health platforms — DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Experienced market leader — DXC Technology has greater than 500 laboratory system deployments. DXC is a market leader within UK & Ireland, Spanish and Danish market and has a heritage of over 25 years' experience of developing, implementing and supporting LIMS products. Product tailored for Southern Europe & LATAM markets — DXC PAT-Win is tailored for the Southern Europe and Latin American markets to best meet these market needs such as support for GDPR regulation and with LOPD (a separate Spanish regulation on Data Protection) and multi-language support. DXC Technology has greater than 500 laboratory system deployments worldwide In Spain DXC PAT-Win is deployed in 17 regions and across 118 facilities DXC provides consultancy and support on 3rd party labs systems in a number of markets Organizations require an integrated anatomy pathology system: PAT-Win allows integration with any clinical and administrative management system of patient information which guarantees that the quality and homogeneity of the locally stored patient data with the hospital or regional data. Pathology departments need information that is secure and accurate yet flexible: An Archiving of versions that stores an image of each final report issued and after the completion or revision of the same. Very flexible protocol structure that can be integrated with tumor registries of regional information systems. See reports & place orders while mobile: e-PAT, the web application linked to PAT-Win, can be used from any device equipped with a web browser and gives users easy access to PAT-Win reports. It let users track patients, which means that a notification will be shown when new reports are generated for those patients. Also, e-PAT can be used to place pathology orders in PAT-Win from an external service, removing dependence on third-party software and complex integration solutions. All the information in a case can be codified using SNOMED CT for easier data exploitation or with interoperability purposes. Availability: Southern Europe and Latin American countries Licensing: License is based on hospital size and complexity, and is measured by the number of beds, type of ownership (public or private), and which modules are required. Typical Initial Conract lengths: 5-7 years  CLIENT REGION INDUSTRY CLOSED/WON  Hospital Central do Funchal Iberia Healthcare Q3 2019 IVO (Instituto Valendiano de Oncologia) Iberia Healthcare Q1 2016  Schedule an introduction session to DXC Pat-Win with the DXC team.

fields.full_body: pathology process, macroscopic, microscopic, patient, anatomy, registration, results, reports DXC PAT-Win is DXC`s Anatomy Pathology Solution for Southern Europe and Latin America. DXC PAT-Win spans the entire pathology process from registering samples as they arrive, specifying and documenting the macroscopic and microscopic descriptions and observations, and then generating outputs including printing and cost control. DXC PAT-Win is easily integrated with other information systems. The solution receives requests from other applications directly; this relieves the pathology service from performing tasks such as samples and patient registration, thereby improving the quality of management and reducing errors in transcription and interpretation. PAT-Win also sends the results (reports) automatically, either to the requesting application or to an independent application. DXC PAT-Win is organized into processes aimed at easily controlling the input and use of data, allowing the control and exhaustive processing of the information within the busy working environment of Pathology departments. DXC PAT-Win enables detailed and accurate recording of all laboratory activities ensuring efficiency and safety. Extensive and meaningful audit data allows laboratory performance to be monitored and analyzed to enable best practice and LEAN workflows. Because PAT-Win is adapted to users' work styles through a wide range of configurable functions, it can support all the daily tasks of a pathology service smoothly and easily. For example, samples that arrive at a Pathology department can be registered using different techniques. Macrocospic and microscopic descriptions and observations can be specified and diagnostic results assigned. Outputs can then be generated, reports can be printed, and costs can be controlled. Leading the way with digital health platforms — DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Experienced market leader — DXC Technology has greater than 500 laboratory system deployments. DXC is a market leader within UK & Ireland, Spanish and Danish market and has a heritage of over 25 years' experience of developing, implementing and supporting LIMS products. Product tailored for Southern Europe & LATAM markets — DXC PAT-Win is tailored for the Southern Europe and Latin American markets to best meet these market needs such as support for GDPR regulation and with LOPD (a separate Spanish regulation on Data Protection) and multi-language support. DXC Technology has greater than 500 laboratory system deployments worldwide In Spain DXC PAT-Win is deployed in 17 regions and across 118 facilities DXC provides consultancy and support on 3rd party labs systems in a number of markets Organizations require an integrated anatomy pathology system: PAT-Win allows integration with any clinical and administrative management system of patient information which guarantees that the quality and homogeneity of the locally stored patient data with the hospital or regional data. Pathology departments need information that is secure and accurate yet flexible: An Archiving of versions that stores an image of each final report issued and after the completion or revision of the same. Very flexible protocol structure that can be integrated with tumor registries of regional information systems. See reports & place orders while mobile: e-PAT, the web application linked to PAT-Win, can be used from any device equipped with a web browser and gives users easy access to PAT-Win reports. It let users track patients, which means that a notification will be shown when new reports are generated for those patients. Also, e-PAT can be used to place pathology orders in PAT-Win from an external service, removing dependence on third-party software and complex integration solutions. All the information in a case can be codified using SNOMED CT for easier data exploitation or with interoperability purposes. Availability: Southern Europe and Latin American countries Licensing: License is based on hospital size and complexity, and is measured by the number of beds, type of ownership (public or private), and which modules are required. Typical Initial Conract lengths: 5-7 years  CLIENT REGION INDUSTRY CLOSED/WON  Hospital Central do Funchal Iberia Healthcare Q3 2019 IVO (Instituto Valendiano de Oncologia) Iberia Healthcare Q1 2016  Schedule an introduction session to DXC Pat-Win with the DXC team.

fields.meta_keywords: citizen documentation, patients, portal, diseases, KOL, senior citizens, rehab, mobile
fields.meta_description: DXC VITAE Suite supports coordinated care across home care, community care, nursing homes, rehabilitation, and social services.
fields.page_body: DXC VITAE Suite consolidates patient information into one place supporting coordinated care across home care, community care, nursing homes, rehabilitation, and social services. The suite includes modules for documenting and communicating information, scheduling services, and planning care. The suite also includes mobile functionality, reporting, and the ability to integrate with other services through a portal. It will: Deliver flexible and high-quality citizen documentation electronically Ensure that citizens get the agreed service on time with the optimal utilization of the care workers Ensure that citizen information is securely and safely shared among the care workers in the organization that works with the citizen Create a shared mobile workspace for the assessment officer, home care, rehabilitation center, social workers, and private providers in the community Supports high and efficient cooperation and communication among all parties in the community The Home Care business area comprises authorities and care providers within: Home care Nursing homes Home nursing The Training and Rehabilitation business area comprises authorities and healthcare providers within: Training Prevention initiatives aimed at patients, for example chronics with diabetes 2 or KOL Prevention initiatives aimed at citizens, for example lifestyle-related diseases or preventive home visits to the senior citizens The Social Services business area comprises authorities and service providers within: Residential accommodation and 24-hour care for the mentally, psychologically and physically disabled Centers for treatment of drug and alcohol addiction/dependency Residential accommodation for adults, for example crisis centers, shelters and care homes Day care services, for example sheltered work Day and night services for children and adolescents Family care for children and adolescents Services for disadvantaged children and adolescents Home care, community care, nursing homes, rehabilitation, and social services require access to and the ability to get and record patient information for effective communication of information, scheduling services, and planning of care. VITAE Record is a tool for documentation and communication. It creates the framework for a shared workspace, irrespective if the user is an assessment officer, home care, rehabilitation center, social worker, or private provider. It is possible to define and continuously adjust the workspace of the individual staff member so that it supports their daily work. The modules of DXC VITAE Suite contain targeted functionality and each module can be configured and adjusted to local organizations, classifications, and the need for documentation. It is also a mobile solution that can be used online at the citizen's home, with full access to all records and with offline capabilities that ensure access to selected data even when there's no network coverage. Furthermore, the patient can be given access to their own data through a special web portal. The data captured within DXC VITAE Suite can be analyzed by rich business intelligence tools for population health or business optimization purposes. Leading the way with digital health platforms — DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Single comprehensive solutions across the ecosystem — some competitors have niche products that support a single area whereas DXC VITAE Suite supports multiple areas (Home care, Community care, Nursing homes, Rehabilitation, Social Services) in one product and database enabling care coordination and consolidated reporting. Note: DXC VITAE Suite can also be delivered stand-alone to support one area or combined. DXC VITAE SUITE is currently deployed at approximately 20 customers/organizations It currently covers potentially 1.3 million citizens across clients/municipalities Improving efficiency Client Challenges: Cost of documentation process & time travelling too high. Current State: Documentation process is heavily paper-based, slow and cumbersome and typically completed back in the office after the visit. Desired Future State: Optimized visits and a reduction in documentation time by at least 50 % including: Less service personnel time spent on documentation; Higher quality of the documentation as the citizen confirms the result. DXC Answer: DXC VITAE Suite uses route planning and case management optimization to reduce the time spent on the road. For documentation, do it together with the patient while at his or her house. The VITAE Go mobile solution for iOS and Android give this opportunity. Improve quality and coordination of care Client Challenges: Lack of or unreliable sharing of information. Patients not able to directly engage in their own health improvements. Low service quality with inefficient utilization of employees and care workers. Current State: Inefficient and unreliable exchange of information. Desired Future State: More efficient and reliable exchange of information provided by: Digital communication and exchange of information; Documentation of treatment that is digital and meeting federal regulations and caregivers and ordering authority enabled to access critical client and patient information anytime, anywhere. DXC Answer: DXC VITAE Suite enables digital communication, enforces structured documentation of treatments and exchanges documentation with national databanks. VITAE Care Portal enables a secure way for the clients to offer the patients easy interaction and access to their care record. Its planning tool receives automatically all the scheduled services so it can automatically utilize and distribute the service among the care workers that are going to deliver all the services to the citizens. Security of access to data Client Challenges: Ensuring that only authorized personnel can access client and patient information. Current State: Lack of secure storage of patient information creates risk that unauthorized personnel may be able to access client and patient information. Desired Future State: Secure storage of patient and client information that allows: Client and patient information to be accessed securely at the point of care; Caregivers and ordering authority enabled to access critical client and patient information anytime, anywhere. DXC Answer: DXC VITAE Suite's authorization and authentication model provides a secure, yet flexible way of ensuring that all data access is properly authorized. Availability: Current target clients are municipalities in countries of Denmark and Sweden. Future clients could be other countries from the Nordic markets or OECD countries with high focus on coordinated care. Pricing/Licensing model: Pricing is highly customized based on the specific market, modules and configurations required. Often the price model is based on a per-citizen model. Average TCV: $4M Please contact the Offering Manager listed in the contacts section for latest information on client wins. Competition Team Online (Bosted): Strong in support of social services business processes but cannot meet client demands in enterprise solution. IBM DUBU (Denmark): Solution is only for support of children business processes. No enterprise solution but the solution being sponsored by public buying organization in Denmark. CGI Treserva (Sweden): Severe problems in delivery to key client has impacted reputation. Schedule an introduction to DXC VITAE Suite with the DXC team.

fields.meta_keywords: MicroHIS X, MIRA, Medicom, ProMedico
fields.meta_description: DXC MicroHIS is a solution for General Practitioners in the Dutch market to use to support their administrative and clinical business processes. It is also used in smaller outpatient clinics, as well as in all medical services of the prisons in the Netherlands.
fields.page_body: DXC MicroHIS is designed for efficient consulting and practice management. It helps Dutch General Practitioners improve efficiency, enhances the quality of patient experience, and increases staff productivity and accountability. MicroHIS enables patients to make their own appointments and re-order their chronic medication via a portal that is managed by an assistant at the practice/clinic. DXC MicroHIS is known for its broad scale of communication/interface capabilities with hospitals, laboratories, national spine, decision support tools, scientific research programs of several universities, and single sign-ons with a variety of applications of third parties. It has a user-friendly solution for the Episode Oriented Register (EGR). Required data is derived from all relevant screens and are accessed directly on the relevant Episode link. With MicroHIS, it is also possible to maintain one or more sub-contacts together in the worksheet and link them to relevant episodes. Primary and community healthcare delivery organizations are under increased pressure to achieve efficiencies and quality of service. DXC MicroHIS allows for very fast data processing and provides users with optimal working speed, and navigation through the application with a minimum number of clicks. New patients are processed quickly and clearly on the system via a screen. Data can then be transferred to Excel or Word from various screens for further processing. Leading the way with digital health platforms—DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Comprehensive solution that has been designed in consultation with users—The product's "look and feel" is familiar, but is also stylish and innovative. The uniform and clear presentation of data—and the ability to choose a unique color scheme for the tool—makes working with MicroHIS very attractive. Quick to deploy —DXC MicroHIS is available as a hosted service making it quick to deploy and rollout to new customers. DXC MicroHIS is currently deployed at approximately 600 customers (GP's). They are responsible for circa 2 million patient records. The first "MicroHIS Patient Notification Pillar" went live in a large primary care center in April 2014. Create single point of contact Client Challenges—When facing problems, the client is often sent from pillar to post between the different suppliers; this causes dissatisfaction. Current State—The GP practice faces many suppliers for the wide variety of ICT-related activities, such as software, hosting, hardware, communication, consultancy, support and training. Desired Future State—Single point of contact for all aspects of service including software, hosting, consultancy, and end-user support. DXC Answer—DXC provides a single point of contact which offers the client clarity, shortens the pass-through time of issues which increases customer satisfaction. Create a coordinated care solution for chronic patient care Client Challenges—Patients' medical data is fragmented across different applications provided by multiple suppliers. This results in significant differences in process and outcome indicators. On an authorized regional level, these differences create inefficiencies and can have a negative impact on reimbursements for GP practices. Current State—The client has a wide variety of different applications in place from several suppliers. Desired Future State—Integrated solution for GPs and care community groups in primary care. DXC Answer—An integrated solution for basic GP care and specialized care for chronic patients, which allows regions to buy a total solution for day-to-day care for patients in primary care. This solution offers clients a major step forward in reliable data and cost effectiveness. Create a strong service-oriented approach Client Challenges—The client is shopping for additional services in the market; these frequently do not meet their needs. Other companies' knowledge of MicroHIS to develop additional services, consultancy and training is often too limited. Clients nowadays need not only software, but extra services and consultancy so that GP practices are well run and are able to fulfill their commitments, both internal and external. Current State—Clients are shopping in the market for additional services to create a total solution. Desired Future State—A total solution that includes a broad service palette for a strong commitment between customers and supplier. DXC Answer—DXC has broadened the current software and hosting solution to include more service components–e.g., training programs, consultancy offerings, and service modules–than it had previously. This contributes to a stronger brand name for our solution and results in satisfied clients. Availability:—The Netherlands Pricing/Licensing model—Pricing is made up of software licensing and hosting charges. Minimum software license is based on 2.350 patients per GP practice. Licenses are priced based on the size of an organization. The factors that determine pricing include number of patients, number of add-on modules, number of add-on services and number of data connections. Please contact the Offering Manager listed in the contacts section for latest information on client wins. Schedule an introduction to DXC MicroHIS with the DXC team.

fields.meta_keywords: CSC LIMS, Abbott, Capita, Cerner Ltd, CliniSys, InterSystems(TrakHealth), Roche Diagnostics, Sunquest, Technidata
fields.meta_description: DXC LIMS is a Laboratory Information Management (LIMS) solution that supports the workflows required by hospital and private laboratories in completing patient diagnostic testing.
fields.page_body: DXC LIMS is the next generation Laboratory Information Management (LIMS) solution that helps hospital and pathology laboratories meet the evolving demands of a modern laboratory/pathology service. DXC LIMS is designed from the ground up to provide leading edge support to pathology laboratories. DXC LIMS is designed from the ground up to provide leading edge support to pathology laboratories. With a range of robust capabilities, managers can scale and customize DXC LIMS to suit operational requirements while scientists can modify specific functions for explicit and local laboratory environments. DXC LIMS is typically delivered as a cloud service, but it can also be locally hosted. DXC LIMS is a web based solution that delivers a complete laboratory management system to all core pathology disciplines including a dedicated mortuary component. DXC LIMS enables client working processes to be reflected in client configured workflow and manages that workflow to ensure all necessary checks and measures are performed prior to publishing results. DXC LIMS enables detailed and accurate recording of all laboratory activities ensuring efficiency and safety. Extensive and meaningful audit data allows laboratory performance to be monitored and analyzed to enable best practice and LEAN workflows. DXC LIMS integrates with all clinical systems, analytical platforms and digital pathology solutions enabling seamless order and results communication to all destinations using all types of message protocols. Integrated business intelligence tools support real time laboratory performance monitoring and clinical dashboards. Leading the way with digital health platforms—DXC offers end-to-end digital healthcare transformation services from strategic advisory services to industry software, transformation, integration, deployment and operational management. Experienced market leader—DXC Technology has greater than 500 laboratory system deployments. DXC is a market leader within UK & Ireland, Spanish and Danish market and has a heritage of over 25 years' experience of developing, implementing and supporting LIMS products. Modern product on modern platform—DXC LIMS is a newly designed and developed LIMS based on a modern architecture and technologies and can be deployed to DXC's secure and scalable Healthcare Cloud. DXC Technology has greater than 500 laboratory system deployments worldwide. In UK NHS, ~60% of tests in England, Scotland, Wales & Ireland which equates to > 600 million tests per year go through a DXC Labs system. In Denmark, 3 out of 5 regions which covers > 50% population use a DXC owned Labs system. In Spain the DXC Spanish labs product is deployed in 17 regions and across 118 facilities. DXC provide consultancy and support on 3rd party labs systems in a number of markets. DXC also have Lab system deployments of DXC owned labs systems in Latin America, Africa, Asia & Middle East plus host a 3rd party in New Zealand. For customers who are concerned about: Pathology scaling—Healthcare organizations are seeing an ever increasing load & higher throughput expectations of their pathology services due to aging population, ability to test for more conditions, more testing as part of standard clinical pathways and requirement to turnaround test results whilst the patient is actively being managed by the clinician. Public pathology services are required to deliver this service within the existing cost per capita. This is leading to changing organizational and discipline specific boundaries to achieve economies of scale and wider and speedier access to clinical and operational data improving patient outcomes/safety. Ability to introduce new models of clinical care and respond to changes in demand—Existing LIMS systems were typically designed and initially developed 20+ years ago and are limited in their architecture, technologies and design to quickly respond to change and be deployed in a modern landscape. “Old IT lab perception”—Use of aging technologies used with existing LIMS systems can make Lab appear to be not an attractive place to work. Increasing quality and regulatory requirements—As a key contributor to accurate patient diagnosis and care pathway determination then pathology services are coming under increasing scrutiny to ensure compliance with best and safe practice. Target market: New logos—Mortuary (globally, currently available in English but supports localization). LIMS; UK and Ireland pathology labs; DXC LIMS is available for other territories but may require language localization and some development for local workflows and regulatory compliance. Existing customers—DXC LIMS for existing UK and Ireland hospital laboratory customers. Potential for Mortuary to be an add-on sale to existing customer base. Typical deal size—0,5-5M$ Timeline for ROI—12-18 months for upsell in existing customer base. 18-24 months new deployment Contract lengths—5-7 years    CLIENT  REGION  INDUSTRY  CLOSED/WON     University Hospital of Leicester  UKIIMEA  Healthcare  Q1 2018    Kettering General Hospital  UKIIMEA  Healthcare  Q1 2018   Share our DXC LIMS Offering Overview Schedule an introduction to DXC LIMS via a demonstration

Ability to introduce new models of clinical care and respond to changes in demand—Existing LIMS systems were typically designed and initially developed 20+ years ago and are limited in their architecture, technologies and design to quickly respond to change and be deployed in a modern landscape. “Old IT lab perception”—Use of aging technologies used with existing LIMS systems can make Lab appear to be not an attractive place to work. Increasing quality and regulatory requirements—As a key contributor to accurate patient diagnosis and care pathway determination then pathology services are coming under increasing scrutiny to ensure compliance with best and safe practice. Target market: New logos—Mortuary (globally, currently available in English but supports localization). LIMS; UK and Ireland pathology labs; DXC LIMS is available for other territories but may require language localization and some development for local workflows and regulatory compliance. Existing customers—DXC LIMS for existing UK and Ireland hospital laboratory customers. Potential for Mortuary to be an add-on sale to existing customer base. Typical deal size—0,5-5M$ Timeline for ROI—12-18 months for upsell in existing customer base. 18-24 months new deployment Contract lengths—5-7 years    CLIENT  REGION  INDUSTRY  CLOSED/WON     University Hospital of Leicester  UKIIMEA  Healthcare  Q1 2018    Kettering General Hospital  UKIIMEA  Healthcare  Q1 2018   Share our DXC LIMS Offering Overview Schedule an introduction to DXC LIMS via a demonstration

fields.meta_keywords: records management, information governance, compliant, regulatory, lifetime management, security, access, client information
fields.meta_description: DXC Content Management services facilitate and automate creation, capturing, collaboration, delivery, protection and analysis of enterprise information in the context of business processes and transactions.
fields.page_body: Information becomes more difficult to store, protect, secure and preserve over time. Managing a rapidly growing volume and variety of information needs good intelligence about it. DXC Content Management services facilitate and automate creation, capturing, collaboration, delivery, protection and analysis of enterprise information in the context of business processes and transactions. Our services enable clients to improve and streamline information processes so that clients can remain compliant with organizational and regulatory mandates. Content management improves business efficiency and productivity, information security, and enables significant operational cost savings by managing business content proactively throughout its life cycle from the point of creation. DXC Technology offers flexible delivery options (onpremises, as a service, or hybrid) and commercial models to minimize investment risk. DXC Content Management helps organizations meet compliance requirements, automate business processes, understand and control the data they hold in their systems and make the crucial decisions that will lead to growth and tangible outcomes. Retire legacy applications — Archiving services have enabled a client to shut down a data center and save $23 million with a return on investment of 1,300 percent by retiring 500 applications.  Lower risk — A global investment bank relies on Records Management services to comply with strict Dodd-Frank Act reporting demands from a central repository for all traderelated unstructured data, avoiding potential fines of $725,000 for each act meeting specific criteria.  Act on data privacy regulation — Content Management has enabled customers to achieve compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and similar global legislation by cross-system treatment of data, including provable disposition, avoiding potential multibillion-dollar fines for GDPR noncompliance.  DXC expertise — Skilled DXC Content Management experts help clients set up and execute content management in the best way for their business processes, automate processes and use their content repository innovatively to get additional business value from their information.  Comprehensive content management for all data — Whether digital records or paper, application data or data managed in place in other resources such as SharePoint, a comprehensive content repository for all data simplifies operational procedures, avoids compliance risks and augments the value of managed information.  Flexibility — We offer many options to deliver content management according to your service needs. These include flexible options to access data for almost any purpose, a large number of connectors to capture from almost any channel, and flexible deployment options: on-premises, traditional managed services or as-a-service delivery.  Market-leading solutions — DXC has strong partnerships and extensive implementation experience with Micro Focus, Hitachi Vantara, Microsoft and other partners, whose content and records management solutions are rated highly by analysts.  Global delivery capability — With 95 data centers, 9,200 analytics consultants, >20 global and regional delivery centers, and 20+ years of experience, DXC truly has a global reach.  900+ analytics clients worldwide  9,200+ information management and business intelligence professionals around the world  More than 100 dedicated data scientists in global delivery centers  20+ years of analytics experience with Fortune 500 clients worldwide  Analysts continue to place the software solutions with which DXC works as leaders in archiving and related areas. Our software partners are market leaders in enterprise. In the age of mobility and big data, information easily proliferates in the enterprise and on social media platforms as users consume it through a range of devices and locations. Organizations must have systems in place that can preserve information integrity and enable corporate accountability by ensuring authenticity, accuracy and sources of information used throughout daily business transactions. To make best use of their information, organizations need to automate content-driven business processes and be able to analyze content efficiently. Transition and transformation duration ranges from 3 months to 1 year  Service delivery ranges from 2 to 7 years  Price is variable based on types of data and scale and complexity of business processes  Multiple pricing options are available depending on the scale and complexity of a customer solution  As-a-service options are based on factors such as custodian or user count, object count, amount of data managed, data source count  The offering is globally available  CLIENT REGION INDUSTRY CLOSED/WON  Alcatel lucent N.C. fields.meta_keywords: digital agent, chatbot, artificial intelligence, ai, business process services, customer experience
fields.meta_description: Automate customer experience with powerful solutions from DXC Digital Agent Services.
fields.page_body: Cyber Response Digital Agent The security world is becoming more complex and risky. In May 2019 hackers cost approximately $18M, freezing thousands of city computers and flooding call centers with support calls. Introducing a new DXC Digital Agent solution for Cyber Response, with digital agents providing global 24/7 support and offering proactive warnings of potential cyberattacks. Cyber attack call centers can quickly triage calls and scale during an attack. This is an industry-specific use case of our DXC Digital Agent offering Learn more:  – Once page is accessed, click the "Need help?" yellow button to the right to activate the demo DXC Digital Agent Services deploys cognitive and smart chatbots, using artificial intelligence (AI) and natural language processing for efficient, easy-to-understand customer interactions. Digital agents answer questions, resolve issues and provide seamless interactions across all channels including social and voice. The conversations started with the digital agent on mobile devices move seamlessly over to tablets or laptops, creating better customer experiences. Mobile consumers want information and answers to questions immediately. DXC Digital Agent Services combines natural language processing and an advanced AI engine that reduces cost to serve, improves first contact resolution and improves the customer experience with real-time results. Highlights include: Reduce cost — DXC Digital Agent Services proved that answers can be automatically addressed by a digital agent up to 70% of the time, deflecting an average of 30-40% of calls. Accelerate time to value — Digital agents can be deployed and fully operational in less than 60 days. Efficiency and accuracy — Digital agents have increased first contact resolution (FCR) by 70%. Proven experience — DXC Technology has deployed over 200 unique digital agent use cases with industry-specific libraries. Ability to demonstrate savings, and accelerate bot adoption — The technology powering DXC's Digital Agent Services is currently used in over 60 million interactions per year. We have demonstrated, proven call deflection of up to 80% in many large enterprise accounts. Ability to provide quick Proof of Value (POV) — DXC can assess what can be moved to bots quickly, typically within 10 days, and implement a Digital Agent Services POV pilot within 60 days. Industry libraries of intents — DXC has built FAQ and Q&A libraries for three launch industries making implementation easier and quicker. Consumption-based, per interaction pricing — DXC offers competitive, pay-as-you-g o, as-a-service interaction pricing options. Global and multi-language support — DXC's chatbot support natively supports over 15 languages DXC has deployed over 300 digital agent use cases. DXC helped a large government agency to reduce costs and deflect up to 60% of calls to digital agents. DXC has increased first contact resolution by up to 70%. Many customer experience (CX) organizations are struggling with finding a cost-efficient way to meet the demands for always-on customer service. Enterprises need to reduce cost to serve and deflect interactions from higher cost channels. Customers expect relevant, accurate, real-time results and first contact resolution, and every interaction to be seamless. A conversation started with a bot should not have to be repeated to a live agent. Enterprises face the challenges of understanding what interactions to move to a chatbot, how to implement a chatbot and how to ensure the chatbot answers customers' questions accurately at the first try. Typical deal size — 300K ABR, 1 million total contract value (TCV) QuickStart POV — 50-50K POV, implemented as pilot for 90 days Language support — 15 languages Pricing — Per interaction model pricing, allowing for rapid scale    CLIENT  REGION  INDUSTRY  CLOSED/WON     Valley National Bank  Americas  Banking & Capital Markets  Oct 2018    Ministry of Defence UK  UKIMEA  Public Sector  Jun 2018   CaixaBank  S. Europe  Banking & Capital Markets  Jun 2017  //-->  Engage the offering team by contacting , Offering Manager, CX Automation. Provide a customized demonstration with relevant questions and answers. Perform a data-driven assessment of what can be moved to digital agents analyzing current chat and call logs. Start by proving ROI from a digital agent. Deploy a POV quickly and cost efficiently.

fields.meta_keywords: security, security architecture, security risk management, agile security
fields.meta_description: The DXC Security Strategy and Architecture offering helps organizations define a sound security strategy that aligns with their business objectives and risk appetite and deploy a resilient, agile security architecture upon which successful transformation occurs.
fields.page_body: New assets for this consolidated offering are under construction and will be published when ready. Click View all Related Assets to see what's available now, including those assets for these existing services:. Cloud Security Cloud Security Advisory Services Security Risk Management Advisory Services The DXC Security Strategy and Architecture offering helps organizations define a sound security strategy that aligns with their business objectives and risk appetite, and deploy a resilient, agile security architecture upon which successful transformation occurs. Services supporting this offering include DXC advisory services for Security Risk Management, Cloud Security, Security Strategy and Transformation, Enterprise Security Architecture Assessment, Solution Security Architecture Assessment, and CISO as a Service. Industry alignment—We help clients to align better with industry peers, because of the in-depth security experience, at a senior level, of our trusted advisors in the verticals to which the client belongs. Top-down security approach—Our approach to security is top-down: understanding business objectives before developing strategies to meet these goals and to prepare the client for new risks and new styles of IT. Comprehensive capability—Our portfolio enables us to implement end-to-end security, from strategy, governance to management, monitoring, and compliance. This avoids loss of accountability, decreases complexity, risk and cost, and delivers faster outcomes. Effective transformation—We have the capability to devise and deliver effective security transformation programs, thanks to our experience in complex and highly regulated global environments. DXC offers an end-to-end, product-agnostic approach covering covering strategy, risk and compliance as well as enterprise architecture and workforce, operational and technical security including design, implementation, and management of security solutions. DXC's Cyber Reference Architecture (CRA) is vendor-agnostic, granular and versatile to enable speed and agility. Our CRA is a highly structured framework of nearly 350 discrete security capabilities, which are crafted into solution blueprints to accelerate the development of roadmaps for security improvement. DXC consultants and operational staff have in-depth knowledge of sector-specific security needs and legal, regulatory, and compliance issues to address key industry business risks of our clients. DXC delivers integrated, innovative and trusted security solutions that minimize data risk and maximize your investment in information security. DXC has the end-to-end capability to implement end-to-end security, from strategy to management, monitoring, and compliance involving people, process and technology change. This avoids loss of accountability, decreases complexity, risk and cost, and delivers faster outcomes. More than 270 strategic security risk management consultants globally and 700 Account Security officers. To ensure clients comply with standards, DXC supplies industry-certified professionals with extensive compliance expertise to advise on regulations such as SOX, HIPAA, PCI DSS, ISO27001, CISSP, SANS, GIAC, IAPP and partner-specific accreditation. DXC security provides industry deep expertise where there is a need for security strategy, enterprise architecture and risk management from a global, trusted supplier. DXC has end-to-end capabilities with in-depth understanding of each industry sector, to help clients understand, reduce and manage risk from: Increasingly sophisticated targeted cyber-attacks by organized groups Cost and complexity of regulatory pressures Rapid transformation of enterprise IT (Digital transformation, hybrid cloud, mobile connectivity, big data explosion and IoT) DXC: Has more than 270 strategic security risk management consultants globally and more than 700 Account Security Officer (ASO) and Security Compliance Officers (SCO) globally Consultants have a minimum of 5–10 years of experience at the highest security levels Consultants have best practice certifications, for example: CISM, CISSP, IISP, CISA, ISO27001, HIPAA, PCI DSS, SANS, GIAC, IAPP and partner-specific accreditation Consultants have in-depth experience in clients' own verticals and with local legal and regulatory needs Consultants give vendor-neutral technology advice and tailor solutions to client requirements Security budgets are increasing, but the security posture gap is getting wider Lack of integration, no understanding of the cyber security risk posture throughout the business making it difficult to reduce the business risk Lack of prioritization – security investment is allocated to implement the latest security trend/tech, without addressing first the security foundations Bottom-up technical silos results in a lack of alignment between security solutions deployed and business objectives Lack of optimization – Overlap of security controls, not taking advantage of virtualization or new functionality in existing security tools Reinventing the wheel – increases time, cost and risk Consultancy-led services: Timescales from 10–30 days for assessments through to 12–24 months for large-scale transformation programs. Consulting services available globally, with delivery through local and/or globally leveraged resources. Consulting pricing model is typically based on a Time & Materials basis. In some cases, a fixed price can be negotiated with the approval from the Regional Delivery Lead Services may be delivered individually, or bundled as a solution All service pricing is contingent on a delivery-led scoping phase  CLIENT  REGION  INDUSTRY  CLOSED/WON    UK Government Security  UKIIMEA  Public Sector  Sep 2018  Warwickshire Police  UKIIMEA  Public Sector  Sep 2018  Brose  N.C. Europe  Manufacturing  Sep 2018  Lurssen  N.C. Europe  Manufacturing  Sep 2018  MENA Assistance  UKIIMEA  Travel, Transportation & Hospitality  Jun 2018   BASF  N.C. Europe  Energy  Aug 2017    Heineken  Americas  Manufacturing  Jul 2017   Public Sector Defense  N.C. Europe  Banking & Capital Markets  Jun 2017   SKF  N.C. Europe  Manufacturing  Jun 2017   Omron  N.C. Europe  Healthcare & Life Sciences  May 2017    Associacao Paulista de Medicina  Americas  Healthcare & Life Sciences  May 2017    EON  N.C. Europe  Energy  May 2017   Australian Tax Office  ANZ  Public Sector  May 2017    AUDI AG  N.C. Europe  Manufacturing  Apr 2017    GE Capital Business Process Management Limited  Asia  Banking & Capital Markets  Jan 2017   Fiserv  Americas  Banking & Capital Markets  Mar 2017   ALCATEL-LUCENT  Asia  CME & Tech  Mar 2017   Discuss with the client to what extend their security strategy supports their business objectives. What concerns them most about their security posture and the threats they face? To what extent does their enterprise security architecture support their business objectives? DXC Security Diagnostic Services can quickly tell clients where they stand and provide clear recommendations for accelerated results by: Assessing the current security strategy and the enterprise security architecture and creating an actionable plan of execution Using DXC Cyber Reference Architecture to accelerate digital transformation Use these conversation starters: Has the corporate security strategy been defined, describing how the client would like the security posture to look in two to five years time, in terms of vision, goals and objectives to be achieved including how to address sophisticated risks to their personal, financial and business-critical information? Does the client have a defined enterprise security architecture aligned to Business objectives and the security strategy? Does the client have a defined security transformation plan or set of projects and initiatives which lead to the strategic objectives for security? How does the client ensure the right balance between business opportunities and risk as they move to cloud and mobile solutions? How does the client identify security controls and define adequate enterprise security architectures aligned to their business?

fields.meta_keywords: security incident response, incidence, plan, security breach, forensics, siem, cissp, threat, hunting
fields.meta_description: DXC Threat Hunting and Incident Response is designed to ensure that the client's enterprise has 24x7x365 access to highly skilled security professionals to investigate breaches.
fields.page_body: DXC Threat Hunting and Incident Response is designed to ensure that the client's enterprise has 24x7x365 access to highly skilled security professionals to investigate breaches. DXC incident response advisors work closely with the client's organization to build a collaborative incident plan and jointly define escalation procedures. When a top-tier incident occurs, all required participants are quickly integrated into the response. Minimized breach impact. Quickly identify the extent of the compromise.  Reduced brand damage. Ensure timely insight into breaches so the client’s organization can accurately communicate the severity of the compromise and reduce the uncertainty and misinformation that typically follows a high-profile  breach.  Reduced regulatory fines. By demonstrating optimized response capabilities, the client can minimize potential regulatory fines resulting from breaches.  Flexible resources based on usage. Access to DXC’s resources is related to usage. The client’s organization can purchase a monthly allotment of response hours and draw upon them as needed throughout the month. If the allocation  is not fully consumed, the hours can be carried forward throughout the contract year. After the tenth month of the service year, up to 50 percent of any unused retainer hours can be transferred to other DXC advisory or security diagnostic services,  depending on the commercial package the client chooses.  Global reach, availability, and scale—DXC managed services provide 24x7x365 support to drive and protect the client's business. DXC has 4,000+ security advisors and 12+ Security Operations Centers worldwide.  Advisory-led approach—DXC provides clients with access to some of the most experienced security operators in the world, helping to surgically pinpoint optimization opportunities and craft a security improvement plan. We use  our proprietary Cyber Reference Architecture to help clients achieve best practice and gain significant risk reduction.  Industry-recognized, and NSA-accredited expertise in incident response—DXC advisors offer comprehensive reactive and proactive incident response services using the latest threat intelligence and leading technology. Expert teams  with deep forensic experience deliver cost-effective rapid responses minimizing business disruption and use globally-available state-of-the-art forensic laboratories and testing facilities to deliver tailored forensic advice and assistance.  Intelligence-driven approach—DXC proprietary threat intelligence is gathered from our experience with providing security to some of the largest companies in the world and responding to scores of incidents each year. This intelligence  is an advantage in identifying the most severe of threats that would otherwise evade detection.  End-to-end security services—DXC is one of few companies offering a single source for security advisory services, managed services, and third-party technology, enabling delivery of complete remediation plans and security improvement  programs.  70 security incident and forensics consultants available 24x7 who can respond to incidents globally  NSA-Accredited Incident Response (IR) and Forensics capabilities  Experienced consultants hold civil and criminal digital forensic litigation and best-practice certifications: CISSP, EnCase and Access Data Certified Examiners, SANS – GIAC Certified Forensic Analyst  Accredited on all major SIEM technologies, consultants provide vendor-neutral technology advice The continuously evolving cyber threat landscape means all organizations are at risk of assaults on their enterprises. Adversaries are highly motivated and well-funded, often belonging to criminal syndicates or nation states. This new generation of attackers employ techniques such as ‘living-off-the-land' to remain undetected while quietly stealing IP, financial and other sensitive data such as personal information over an extended period of time.  Threat Hunting and Incident Response is offered as retained services  The client’s organization can purchase a monthly allotment of response hours and draw upon them as needed throughout the month. If the allocation is not fully consumed, the hours can be carried forward throughout the contract year.  After the tenth month of the service year, up to 50 percent of any unused retainer hours can be transferred to other DXC advisory or security diagnostic services, depending on the commercial package the client chooses      CLIENT   REGION   INDUSTRY   CLOSED/WON        ABB GROUP   N.C.
